reviews.text: Overall I like cheesecake factory. But today was ridiculous. Waiter was quite rude. <br>We ordered tea, the cups were so dirty. How can you serve anything like this?? <br>If they are so dirty and it is ok for them, I aftaid what other kitchen is like. My girlfriend went to a restroom and washed glasses. Ridiculous.

My hubby and I are big fans of the Cheesecake Factory restaurants (specially of the cheesecakes duh lol). Went here after a day of shopping. I called ahead of time to see what the waiting time would be like and they said no wait, great! We weren&#39;t that hungry so we only stopped for appetizers. <br><br>The host took us to our seats, fast, no problem. We sat down and a nice man bring us bread immediately, wow I&#39;m so amazed!  Later on I see this same man busing tables and setting up tables. <br><br>We wait, we wait and we wait. No server comes around nor acknowledges us. It&#39;s cool we got bread lol. We keep waiting and I&#39;m looking around and I start to notice there aren&#39;t many tables occupied so  I&#39;m starting to get a little disappointed. <br><br>Finally the waiter comes around. He&#39;s friendly. We order drinks and appetizers. We ordered the buffalo wings and the fried calamari. <br><br>Appetizers get here, oh my they look delicious! We tried the buffalo wings and they aren&#39;t delicious to die for as usual :( they&#39;re a little cold but honestly I don&#39;t feel like complaining so we eat them. <br><br>The calamari....awful! It&#39;s so breaded it&#39;s not even funny. The tempura batter or bread to bread it (whatever you call it) it&#39;s overpowering. I can&#39;t find the calamari! It was so awful! No taste like calamari, they taste like batter and oil. <br><br>We ordered cheesecake to go. Tuxedo and lemon raspberry as usual no disappointment there :0)

Came here a year ago for my best friends birthday, they sat the 4 of us who were all dressed up in the back of the restaurant with little to no light and the server did not check on us for a good 10 minutes. Friend got frustrated, I ate the bread. We left
Chicken &#34;Alfredo&#34;? Zero sauce completely dry, yet charged $24 dollars for this? Worst food I&#39;ve eaten. Complete waste of money. Do not waste your time or money!!!

Small Cheesecake Factory location. We sat in the back with small tables for two very close to one another so it didn&#39;t make for an intimate dinner. But our waiter David was fantastic, my husband and I stopped by for a quick bite and we kept him on his toes but he was so great for the short time we were in. Very attentive and quick to respond.
I made order online the women at the front won&#39;t let me pick up I had to wait outside for over 24 min to pick up the email said ready to pick up <br>Never going back

The slowest possible service. Something needs to change. I have been here 3 times and I always see an open table with guests waiting to be seated and recently opened up tables being bussed before ones that have been vacant for longer. I don&#39;t blame the employees everyone here is nice and has a good attitude and the food is always good this is strictly on management. Step it up!!

The original Cheesecake Factory! And boy am I excited to have spent my Saturday night here -- yes I know. I should have been at Spago or something equally as &#34;seen-y&#34;, however the OG Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. <br>First -- let&#39;s talk bread. What do they put in it? Cause I kid you not it is like crack cocaine. You WILL NOT BE ABLE TO STOP EATING THIS. <br><br>We then got the avocado spring rolls, weird appetizer choice I know -- but Greg insisted. <br>Woa was I happy we got those. So much avocado inside a fried outer spring roll shell. OMG COME TO MAMA!!<br> <br>I got the Ahi tuna salad, it was on the skinny menu and the most low cal salad I could find. I don&#39;t know why any restaurant needs to put calories next to the food but hey if you wanted to know 440 calories. I was really in the mood for a Cesar salad but yo if I&#39;m gonna be wasting 1,000+ cals on salad, it better be a Cheesecake. <br><br>Jackson got pasta. Usually the pasta is always good but maybe the kitchen was overwhelmed. It wasn&#39;t seasoned and the sauce was so watery. Not the best. <br><br>Greg got some Thai dish and devoured it in 2 min so I&#39;m assuming it was good. It looked excellent. <br><br>Now for the finale. Cheesecake. O. Baby. Yes. I got the peanut butter Reese&#39;s one and let me tell you. I have never had something so delicious in my mouth. <br>I had a few bites and may have gone to heaven. Peanut butter heaven. The second layer from the bottom. O boy. It&#39;s almost like a snickers bar but better. I am getting aroused just thinking about this cake! <br>Do yourself a favor and come here for the cheesecake -- you will not be disappointed.

My friend and I decided to meet for lunch. The hostess was very attentive as I informed her I was meeting a friend for lunch and she said she will seat me and will direct my friend to the table on her arrival. I always ask for the &#34;brown bread&#34; only, which my request was fulfilled. <br>Was busy of course but that was expected. I ordered a drink I believe a lemon drop and the veggie pasta which was delicious. I didn&#39;t leave any behind. <br>Service was exceptional and will definitely come back again should I be in the area.

I use to come to this place to eat all the time but DO NOT COME EAT AT THIS LOCATION! Saddens me to write this but I&#39;m very disappointed in the staff here. Sat at counter for ten mins without one person asking for help or taking my order! Instead the people at the Togo stand just count there Money, touch cake without gloves, never look up, pay no attention to customers, turn back to customers n make drinks, etc. <br><br>I had enough &amp; told a manager. She gave me a hard time then said you were suppose to order at the front but the people in the front Told me to go to the bakery side  to order Togo! Manager is so dumb to not realize the reception counter is the first thing you see &amp; obviously I asked them or I would&#39;ve never known there was a bakery over there! Smh - I hope guys get it together at this location. Long time customers like myself will probably never come back.

There&#39;s plenty of reviews for this place going on. If you haven&#39;t been here, it&#39;s like your living under a rock. No offense to anyone who hasn&#39;t been, being sarcastic z Based on this experience, I was quite surprised. I&#39;ve visited many of times but never for happy hour. Honestly, never knew they had happy hours. Stopped off at the Beverly Hills location for a quite bite as I had an event to attend later on. Didn&#39;t need to get a table as we were just in for something quite to nosh on and a quick drink. <br>Opted for the bar area. Waiter handed us the menu and then heard the guy next to us saying something about happy hour. As we were short on time, we opted for the happy hour menu as well. The selection is limited but for the price it was outstanding. Drinks the same as well, 6.50. <br><br>Something easy, nachos and sliders. When we saw what came, quite shocked. The order of nachos was humongous. Thinking it was happy hour price, it couldn&#39;t be that big. My god, it was like the regular order enough for a group. Also the chicken sliders, for the price. We thought it was gonna be one maybe two. Four was served, and they were accompanied with the sides on the side. Happy hour here is great. Cheap food and drinks is always a good thing.

Im very very disappointed. This is not what I was expecting. We got sat right away can&#39;t complain  about that. Our waitress came (didn&#39;t event introduce her name) but her name was on the receipt Sofija she was HORRIBLE and we still tipped her more than 20% even though she didn&#39;t deserve it! We decided to tipped her that amount because the bus boy was extremely sweet and nice and he deserved a good tip. We were so closed in tipping the bus boy half of the tips on his hands but decided to just leave it on the table. <br>I ordered ice water with lemons (lemons didn&#39;t come) I had to asked again and Sofija seemed annoyed by me for asking for things but that&#39;s because she didn&#39;t bring them since the beginning and I had to keep remind her! For drinks I order the strawberry blossom, mom ordered the passion margarita, sisters ordered a smoothie ice coffe and a lemonade. Drinks were okay we enjoyed all of them.  For appetizer we ordered  the buffalo chicken strips (amazing appetaizer) and the fried calamari (didn&#39;t like it, didn&#39;t taste good at all, had no flavor and super breaded) I had to ask the bus boy for extra buffalo sauce and ranch because waitress never showed up, bus boy brought it out quickly. For main entree I ordered the shrimp scampi from the skinny menu (I always always order that) I think waitress put the wrong order and I had do send it back she argued with me saying that&#39;s what I ordered and I said no that&#39;s not what I ordered. She ended up taking it back. 20 mins later I got my dish my family was half done but it&#39;s okay it happens. I asked for more bread and she literally brought two Lorelei pieces of bread with no butter I had to ask her for more butter and again she didn&#39;t seem very happy. Bus boy asked if we wanted more bread and we said yes and he brought plenty bread and he asked if we wanted butter not like Sofija.  My mom ordered the chicken Parmesan piZa style sisters the four cheese pasta with chicken and salmon. Waitress didn&#39;t even check if I got my correct dish. I still<br>Enjoyed my dinner. For dessert we got two dulce de leche cheesecake and a la mode both of them. Food and desserts were delicious as usual. But I&#39;m just kinda upset of the horrible service we received. That&#39;s why we go out to get treated good and because we don&#39;t want to cook at home and want to Enjoy a nice meal with the entire family at the same time. I had to wait 15 to 20 mins to get my dish which is not cool at all.  <br>We spent over 200 dollars for a very mediocre service. That was our experience at Cheesecake Factory Beverly Hills! I know pretty sad!!! Let&#39;s see what management is going to say. Let me guess an automatically response saying sorry to hear  that and I hope you give us another chance lol come on Cheesecake Factory you make millions of dollars you can do better than that. Show that you actually care about your customers because remember if it wasn&#39;t for the customers you wouldn&#39;t be making all this money! Train your employees better or hire people who actually want to do their job.  Can&#39;t wait to hear from management.

Specifically the Beverly Hills location on Rodeo Drive. Albeit, wtf visits a Cheesecake Factory restaurant in RODEO with a dozen or so boutique restaurant experiences that would have served better....but I digress. Sometimes, the menu at this place is exactly what is needed when 3 people can&#39;t decide on a single genre. And my to my personal experience, this place has never failed. But for some reason on this particular day, they did X&#39;s THREE. My taquitos looked AND tasted different and not in a good way. I ate them because, I was hungry. It was taquitos. The other 2 meals were also a major miss. Both were sent back. <br><br>Now, aside from serving craptastic food on this day, they also decided to do the same with their service offering up attitude because we complained. We were NICE when we explained that the food was lacking in flavor. The waitress &amp; manager, maybe took it personally? The pie you offered us in exchange would have been far better received had your attitude not been so incredibly negative. I&#39;m willing to accept that maybe you were having a bad day but still sounds like a YOU problem. <br><br>Thanks for absolutely nothing

So I sit down to this massive burrito; very excited the name matches what I got.  Then I cut into the burrito and it&#39;s 85% rice.  And some kind of sticky Asian rice.  Dis-gust-ing.  <br>I guess I should know better than to order this but clearly I didn&#39;t.  Straight into the trash.  Not even going to try and eat it

Shoutout to the male employee who politely but firmly enforced social distancing rules when the bougie lady behind me got impatient in line and got too close to me. Pick up process was quick and easy. Thanks for the free cheesecake promo during lunch hours!

I will never understand why Cheesecake Factory always has low reviews when WE ALL KNOW THEIR FOOD IS BOMBBBBB!!!! <br><br>I love the bev hills location, only problem is how small the inside is compared to other locations. It&#39;s honestly jam packed. <br><br>However, food wise, always delicious!!! <br>I&#39;ve tried a lot of their items and some is a solid winner and others maybe Not. <br><br>My favorite thing to order is the bistro shrimp and the spicy chicken chipotle pasta. Both are sooo good!!! <br>I&#39;ve probably tried half the pasta menu and those are my favorites . Some of the chicken dishes are great but pasta is always a winner. <br><br>My fav appetizers are the samosas and the calamari. Calamari could use more seasoning if I&#39;m being honest. Too many items to pick from! <br><br>As for Cheesecake... the birthday cake one is great , however my FAVORITE  is SMORES!!!! Highly recommend . Was not a fan of their New York flavor , their Oreo one is good , dolce leche is alright ... cookie dough isn&#39;t as good as I expected it to be. JUST GET SMORES!!!! <br><br>The brown bread served before the meal is the best!!! <br><br>Overall, great place!
Only cheesecake that I have ever gone to where multiple times I have received chicken with more fat in the chicken than meat itself. <br><br>Stay away.

I showed up and waited 10 minutes to be spoken to by anyone in the restaurant. I found someone that worked there and asked if they were taking more customers. I was told yes and then the employee walked away. Didn&#39;t ask how they could help me or anything. I waited a few more minutes before leaving.

The one in The Grove is better. Just saying straight up if you want a nice dinner with great service go there better. My friend gave them his name and number to get a table. They said they would text when it was ready. <br><br>There was a few people in front of us, but once we left his number we went to the corner to talk. The lady at the front said it would be about 25 minutes. After 35 minutes I told my friend to go check.<br><br>When he went inside he was taking awhile so I went after him. I noticed the people before us were already seated. When I asked what&#39;s going on my friend said that they told him they texted him and that he never replied.<br><br>I was with him and kept telling him to check his phone. I never ever saw that text or call. He even confirmed they had the right number and it was right. <br><br>When they finally gave us a table they didn&#39;t give us any bread and butter. We still waited for about 10 minutes for a waiter to get our drink order. <br><br>We finally had our drinks and we ordered our food. They didn&#39;t have what I wanted so they asked if it was okay to substitute it. Okay no problem. <br><br>I remember trying to get his attention to order another drink. He saw me smiled and I said excuse me to get his attention. He walked right passed me! Five minutes later he comes back and asked if we needed anything else. <br><br>Food is still great. Service was horrible.

My mother loves the fried avocado rolls and the Thai lettuce wraps here and she has loved them for as long as I can remember now. This Cheesecake Factory is where I had orange chicken with my first girlfriend as it&#39;s been a favorite hang out since I could barely drive or even walk for that matter. Lol. Also, have you ever tried their spaghetti carbonara? Nothing &#34;Factory&#34; about it at all as it rivals the best carbonara in all of LA!

I absolutely love the Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s amazing!!! I get the Louisiana shrimp pasta and the Georgia peach drink(it&#39;s soooo gooood!) this is my favorite restaurant and I&#39;d recommend anybody to this one a hundred times over! Amazing

I place an order on Mother&#39;s day online and my order was schedule to be ready by 2:45pm....I arrive at 2:45pm and had to stand in line for 45 minutes.... No one was outside to direct the line or to tell us in line what is going on. By the time I got my food at 3:30pm my food was cold. I was not happy at all. <br><br>I would like a response from management<br><br>Kathy

Arrived at 7:20pm on a Thursday night. Made a reservation for 2 people. Manager and host guaranteed that we would be sat by 8:30pm and that we would make the 9:00pm cut off for the kitchen closing. We came back at 8:30. Waited 30 minutes outside. At 9:00pm manager tells us they are not able to seat us. Offers us a free dessert if we order takeout instead. Absolutely horrible service. I was a regular here. Never coming back so many better places to eat in LA. Disappointing.

*** 3.5 Stars ***<br><br>You get exactly what you expect at The Cheesecake Factory, and this is true for all locations including this one:<br><br>The menu is huge - they don&#39;t do anything particularly well, but do everything decently well, so there is something for everyone and no one will be disappointed.<br><br>It&#39;s not exactly cheap, but the portions are large, so it&#39;s a fair value.<br><br>The cheesecake IS great, and there are more flavors than you can imagine, all of which are good.<br><br>NOTE: They now have a skinny menu, with items less than 500/600 calories for the entire serving, and cocktails that are less than 150 calories, something I appreciate since I always feel gluttonous when I eat at a Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Not something to go out of your way for as there is nothing &#34;special&#34; about it, but a decent choice for a casual meet up with a group.

Came for dinner. The food really varies based on location. Food and service wasn&#39;t great. The waiter left the menus on the table after we ordered a small thing but the night just got better. My boyfriend ordered chicken wings and they came out undercooked, nobody wants chicken that&#39;s still bright pink in the middle. The waiter took it back and corrected. We were in a corner behind a tree impossible to flag someone down so no refill on water for me. I had a burger, the fries were a bit old tasting and cold. For the price of the food I was expecting better. <br>Parking is ridiculous, mostly meters on the street or the public lots. They have a valet as well. <br>Overall under impressed. I&#39;m really happy they have gluten free options on the menu but they also don&#39;t change the water for pasta so be aware of that. Just be cautious when ordering gluten free.

Cheesecake Factory @ Beverly hill<br>I expected to have a great experience here <br>But : I drove 400 miles from pinole to L.A.<br>I arrived to the restaurant @ 9:10 pm on dic 26 2018 <br>I waited to get a table 40 mins (NO PROBLEM - IT ALWAYS HAPPENS )<br>I ordered calamari to start - they didn&#39;t have any ...<br>I ordered our main food - they brought  my Santa Fe salad in 35 mins then  my wife angel hair pasta in 45 mins  and my son chicken fettuccini  in 50 mins <br> ( bad timing to serve my food )<br><br>This place is too small and dirty -<br>My experience was terrible in this place <br>@ ( bervely hills)  <br>Normally I go to Cheesecake Factory @<br>Walnut Greek and San Rafael .. they are great   <br>Any ways I gave 2 stars because I took few nice pictures outside on the street

Love love love.  Quite consistent, nice atmosphere.<br>I love especially the chopped salad, roasted artichoke, Asian lettuce wrap tacos.  The Linda&#39;s chocolate cake is the best dessert ever.  The brown bread is never to be missed either.   Great menu and comfy booths.

My friends and I dined here last night for a reunion / birthday, and the service was phenomenal. I think our server&#39;s name was Raul? He was exceptionally nice and fast. <br><br>They even brought out a candle and team of employees to sing me happy birthday, which was above and beyond. I&#39;ve never seen this level of hospitality at any other location for this chain. <br><br>The wait was less than 10 minutes for 6 people. FAST! It&#39;s a smaller location, but that doesn&#39;t hold back the quality of food and service at this location. I prefer it to other cheesecake locations nearby.

This isn&#39;t the best place to eat, nor a go-to but, with so many options including being able to customize your meal it isn&#39;t a bad option either especially for groups. Watch out for large portions and high calories with their yummy food. Love their unsweetened iced tea. This is their original location.

Came in for a late lunch with sister, I think this is probably the smallest Cheesecake Factory location we have ever seen, the table for two was so tiny that it was barely enough for two tiny Asian women. The tourist dining people next to me almost put his backpack on me, but it&#39;s Beverly Hills that space is very precious and expensive so I understand why the super cramped seatings. <br><br>It was a very warm day so we decided to do something refreshing and light. Bourbon and Honey cocktail for me, strawberry lemonade for sister, we shared crab cake bites and Greek salad as apps, Tuscan chicken from skinnylicious and chicken &amp; shrimp in Thai curry with white rice for entrees. As usual, food portions were huge and the flavors were rich that we enjoyed all the dishes. We finished our meal with toasted marshmallow S&#39;mores cheesecake, cappuccino and Grey Goose espresso martini, they were very tasty. <br><br>Our server was very attentive and friendly considering how busy it was, we have always liked The Cheesecake Factory, this location didn&#39;t disappoint either. Keep in mind that this is a very affordable place to grab a bite when you are in this neighborhood.<br><br>Ps. Street meter parkings or public parking structures across the street, first two hours free.
Love it when you&#39;re waiting 30 mins for a plate of wings...and especially loved the moment when the chef was asked how long and he threw his hands up ‍...do better!

Server was great, but food took an hour and a half to actually come out. Truffle flatbread came out with no truffle, so the truffle oil was brought out on the side.. appreciate the effort, but at that point the flatbread was cold and the meal was ruined :/ salad was drenched in dressing, couldn&#39;t be eaten.<br><br>Talked to the manager who was really sweet, as was the server, and as a server I understand when the kitchen is backed up. But that&#39;s why it&#39;s two stars, and not zero. Just a rough experience - don&#39;t go on a weekend, or a busy time! And be prepared for over-seasoned, over-dressed, or wrong order :/

I always love going to the cheesecake factory...delicious food &amp; large portions. We recently had a great meal with the thai lettuce wrap appetizer (which is huge and is enough for a meal), the farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic (always comforting and savory) and the miso salmon which was perfectly cooked and divine!

My family and I will NEVER be returning to this restaurant! This was the last straw! Parents be ware! DO NOT take your kids to this restaurant!!! <br><br>We went to dinner on Sunday night, December 1st to celebrate a birthday, because this has become a sort of birthday tradition for the fam. We  would have sat outside because we had such a bad experience the last time we dined outside, but it was just too cold, so we opted for a table inside--the family usually likes to sit in the front, near the window, to feel like we&#39;re in the center of the action of Beverly Hills. Even though we had a miserable experience last time, we decided to take our chances.  <br><br>To my chagrin, we had the EXACT same waiter that we had the last time we were here, just two weeks ago! They must always have the same waiters on the same tables, because this was the same place we had sat before. I prayed that this person from the wait staff would not once again infect my family with the infectious odors of drugs like the last time, and for the most part, my prayers were answered. <br><br>Again, the food was only so-so. It was blah! And used to be a lot better years ago. I&#39;ve been dining at this restaurant for decades! We had the tamale cakes which actually used to be A LOT better! They just don&#39;t taste the same, Also ordered asian lettuce tacos, tartare, and a chipotle pasta that actually tasted OK. The almond salmon said was too dry, and chicken littles didn&#39;t have much flavor. In my experience, the food USED to be soooo much better! But I digress, because the family seemed to be in a happy mood and we were there to celebrate a birthday. It was supposed to be a joyous occasion! We&#39;ve come here for countless birthdays in the past, and they used to always be amazing, but things have really gone down hill.<br><br>Somehow, after we sat down, we realized we had the exact same waiter as the last time we came to this establishment, just two weeks ago.  They must always use the same waiters on the same tables, because we sat in the very same spot, in the front, next to the window. This used to be a desirable location, but not anymore. <br><br>Things were going okay, our waiter even agreed to come sing happy birthday to us when we ordered a piece of godiva cheesecake. This is when things took a turn for the absolute worst. A crew of waiters came to sing us their rendition of Happy Birthday, which was fine, but then right after the singing, I heard our waiter (the same person who brought us our iced tea and took our order) say the &#34;F&#34; word. Right after the birthday song, the guy chuckled, and said &#34;F*%CK!&#34; There were kids around!!! I could not believe it! We don&#39;t speak like that at home, so we never would have thought that going to, what used to be a family restaurant, we would have experienced something like that! Children should not have to be subject to the F word at public establishments. It was COMPLETELY inappropriate! I couldn&#39;t imagine a worst thing to say right after singing happy birthday. My jaw dropped and I looked at my family in total disbelief.  This was the same person who stunk of drugs the last time we came to this restaurant, and now he was using profanity! We shouldn&#39;t have to be exposed to these sort of things when we choose to dine out. This is why I will NEVER be back!<br><br>I am not the type to tattle and did not want to make a big deal of it while I was there, and ruin our birthday celebration even more,  but my wife and I want to leave this here as a warning to parents: Do not take your family to this restaurant! It is not a safe place for our precious children! The waitstaff is completely inappropriate, and will curse or smell of refer. If you care about your kids, please avoid this place! I know we will NEVER be going back. This waiter ruined it for us! I should have known better from my last experience, but it seems things are just going down-hill.

Not what I expected. We went to the cheese cake factory to get a family dinner. We committed for extra bread, extra butter, and utensils. When we came home to eat there was no utensils, extra bread, and extra butter instead we got half loafs of each type and 3 pieces of butter. on top of that we got no utensils which was requested and separately added to order .The food was ok. I do not have any other complaints but next time I hope I at least have utensils.

Eric is a great bartender! Created a sparkling good day for us one recent happy hour. I wish they had a corn chowder though. ... Great food and great prices. Appreciate the miltary discount! Have a great day!!!!<br><br>Kevin was an awesome bartender! He has skills! He&#39;s been here a while and we appreciate him.

Augustine is the walking definition of HAPPINESS. He made our experience amazing! His energy and good spirit lightens up the room! Thank you Augustine our family wishes you nothing but prosperity and longevity! <br><br>Thank you!
the food is bussin but the lady with the tat on her arm is rude and discriminates black people

If I can review this place a zero it would be. Our party waited 2 hours to get seated. We were a party of 17 but we told them whatever tables are available and we can sit anywhere. Not together or what ever configuration they had. It was so hard for them to grasp a table of 5, a table of 4, etc etc to total 17. We did not even need to get seated at the same time. So hence the wait was 2+ hours. We had kids so they were hungry and there was no other place there nor we wanted to caravan at another place. We probably could have just said each family and table number but it&#39;s like saying I want a 12 foot sandwich but split in 2 for two 6 inch. It was hard for them to grasp the concept. When we ordered the kids meal I was also told the Mac and cheese did not come with a side while my other child&#39;s chicken tender had a side (fries or fruit) but at other cheesecake factories they had sides. I&#39;m sitting right now at a different location Cheesecake Factory and both my kids have sides. Also when we were seated we were not offered a kids menu. We were seated at other locations and were asked if we needed kids menus.

The level of incompetency and complete disregard for their customers&#39; well being is absolutely ridiculous and disgusting. I specifically ordered a Tiramisu cheesecake and was delivered a Peanut Butter one instead just because they felt like it. I have a severe peanut allergy, and the fact that they didn&#39;t have the decency to so much as call and ask what I would like it to be substituted for is ludicrous. Not to mention, when I called the manager and asked him to fix the order and send the correct one and let him know about my peanut allergy, he had a tough luck attitude and after I told him that this was absolutely insane, decided to try to compensate me with a gift card in the amount of the cheesecake. So if I end up in hospital with a severe reaction to the peanut you decided to send me because of your negligent and careless behavior and incur medical expenses and emotional distress as a result, I&#39;m supposed to be happy with a $4 gift card? Unbelievable.

Thankful for the awesome staff today!<br>Really appreciated them!<br>I dealt with the worst mom-shaming experience that left me in tears with my 2.5 year old. <br>From the staff making sure I was okay, bringing my son extra fruit, and kept apologizing about the rude guest...I don&#39;t wish this on any parent, but the staff made me want to continue my lunch.<br><br>Thank you !

My understanding is that this is the First and Original Cheesecake Factory. We have been coming here for almost a decade now and the staff/service are always on point. Nothing out of the ordinary here: much like your local location!

Really unfortunate visit to this location. I&#39;ve had several visits to Cheesecake Factory over the years this was absolutely awful. Our server was nice, I ordered the chicken and biscuits and my partner the Alfredo pasta. After waiting 45 minutes the server came by to tell me that they had no biscuits prepped and had to make them from scratch. It was no problem waiting. The biscuits came out Burnt and hard my partners pasta was sent back as it came back watered down. The manager took off her pasta and gave us a free cheesecake. Wasn&#39;t worth the wasted time and hungry tummy&#39;s. Never again.

On June 21 a few weeks ago, I got married.  We took the wedding party here.  It was around 4pm.  We were 13.  We were told an hour wait.  I explained our situation, and were seated within 10 Min.  The hostess was awesome.  There is no other word.  The food was great as always.  Very consistent.  Along with the Food, the servers were very attentive.<br>Couldn&#39;t have asked for a better place to share this special occasion.
The best place ! best service too .<br>love to going here every month .<br>i love the marina del ray and sherman oks one and the grove one too !
the food is great. <br>the wait staff is moderately bad and inattentive. <br>the bus staff is ineffective <br>they ran out of bread, wtf?<br>took brussels sprouts off the menu. boo!

Got here at 7:15 for a date with my boyfriend before he leaves the country, was told that it was a one hour and 45 min wait. I saw on yelp that they close at 9 and asked the hostess if it would be problematic to be seated later because of closing time and she said not at all so we waited. At 8:45 she told us that there were still 2 people ahead of us even though all of the tables were completely empty and no one was waiting outside. It was very obvious that they just didn&#39;t want to seat us and we waited almost two hours for nothing. She told us to just order take out so we did that and ended up having to wait another 20 min for our food to be ready. At 9:30 we hadn&#39;t even received our food yet/gone home to eat. Listen to the rest of the reviews, unless you&#39;re showing up at 4 pm to secure your spot, don&#39;t go.

To meet an out of town guest for dinner, we chose the Beverly Hills Cheesecake Factory for its proximity to Westwood and the restaurant has great cheesecake.  It was located easily across the street from the public parking lot.  As its fairly dark inside, taking photos together was a bit tough.  <br><br>Service was as expected for a Sunday dinner at 6 pm, and our waitress was very pleasant.  The rye bread took a while to bake..., five minutes turned into twenty.  The avocado egg rolls were overrated, while the crispy crab cake bites were tastier with two types of dipping sauces (tartar and honey mustard).  I preferred the former.  The Chicken Madeira dish I ordered for the first time was satisfying and the bow tie pasta was al dente, but the cheese they used in the dish and/or grated on top had an overly strong aftertaste and aroma. <br><br>The white chocolate raspberry cheesecake was great, although I would have preferred another garnish besides just the whipped cream -- like mint, a small raspberry, or chocolate drizzle -- to make it look as good as it tasted.

I&#39;ve never been to any Cheesecake Factory and thought to myself, &#34;wow, what excellent service&#34;.<br><br>I don&#39;t even require much, just acknowledge my existence with a SMILE, tell me you&#39;ll be right back and then go on about your day. <br><br>I don&#39;t need attention, don&#39;t need you to ask how my food is, nope! . I&#39;d understand if it was during rush hour, but don&#39;t be friendly to the tables around me and then come spewing shit my way! <br><br>But god forbid any server there acknowledges you! <br><br>The only time they&#39;re friendly is when i ask for the bill. I&#39;m sorry, but why would you expect a great tip when your service was mediocre as hell??<br><br>I asked what type of bread was gonna be in the order and the server replied with, oh it&#39;s just a bread and then stared at me! <br><br>No shit Sherlock. I asked what kind of bread it was. <br><br>Anyway, this is my fourth shitty experience with this restaurant and I am over it.<br><br>I&#39;ll take my hard earned money to ppl who deserve it.<br><br>Get better servers as your food isn&#39;t that great either<br><br>Also, if more than 30 ppl have complained about your shitty servers, maybe do something about it?

Ordered pasta carbonara with extra sauce and the entree arrived with no sauce at all. My receipt clearly indicates I paid for the extra sauce but the pasta is dry as a bone. When reported to the manager, he could not have cared any less and told me to contact DoorDash. It&#39;s not a delivery issue, it&#39;s a kitchen error!

Went here on a beautiful Tuesday afternoon. Had a seat outside. Staff was quick and when they ran out of bread the waiter made sure to let us know and had us refills right away. I had a good pasta with great flavor and my mom had a salad which was so much better. Service was great, food, and great atmosphere.

I always come to this place with my family and friends, as my friends and I were walking out an employee told us to go to McDonalds around the corner because we split the check so they ran out of patience for no reason. I am just truly appalled and disgusted, in any place of business you shouldn&#39;t talk like that to your customers. The manager was truly unprofessional and not leaving us in a positive state of mind or reassurance. I never expected this from such a well known restaurant and I will not be returning here again.<br><br>This is an update, I have not received a phone call back from this terrible corporation. The lady questioned me on the phone like I was talking to the police or something and she told me they would call me back with an update within the next couple days or so and I never received an email or a phone call. Just terrible.

The food was good but we Waiting for two hours for the food when the people next to us order after us receive the food aid the food before even we receive the food when we came to the manager and complain to Sam sorry and this was the end I think she should address this issue Ariela bit more responsibility of the action of the restaurant therefore I do not recommend to stay over 30 minutes when you order the food and the food do not come just leave the restaurant

Who goes shopping in Beverly Hills and then has lunch at a Cheesecake Factory?!  This gal apparently.  Honestly, my SO has never been to one and there wasn&#39;t a line for a late afternoon lunch so we took the plunge.  <br><br>This isn&#39;t the giant sized typical CF location.  Our little table for two was tiny and so tightly packed that my chair was constantly being knocked by servers passing by (we were also near the kitchen exit).  Knowing how much food a CF meal usually involves, I wondered how they were going to get all of that on our tiny table.  They managed.  But we weren&#39;t exactly comfy and neighboring tables are extremely close.  <br><br>My SO wasn&#39;t adequately prepared for the sheer volume of options at a Cheesecake Factory.  It really is overwhelming.  She settled on the Veggie Melt with sweet potato fries.  It looked very cheesy and she did like it.  I went with the Spicy Crispy Chicken Sandwich with Buffalo sauce.  It was better than I anticipated with lots of creamy blue cheese sauce.  <br><br>Although we were both having sandwiches, our server still brought bread to the table.  So gluttonous.  And glutenous I suppose.  Anyway their bread is still pretty good, so no complaints.  <br><br>Service was fast and very friendly.  The experience was probably 3.5 stars with the better than average food and good service, but the cramped quarters make it hard to enjoy what is a pretty reliably decent meal.

They have great cheesecake, but everyone needs to try Linda&#39;s fudge cake. It is the best chocolate cake you will ever have. Yes it&#39;s super rich and loaded with sugar and I&#39;m sure too many calories, but it is worth it. Everything from the cake to the frosting to the chocolate chips on the end make it the most delicious chocolate cake probably cake you will ever have. I can&#39;t say enough about it. It&#39;s so moist and they give you a huge piece. I have to stop myself from finishing all of it at once bc one slice is probably a weeks worth of fat and calories but again worth it. <br><br>Some other notable favorites are the vanilla bean cheesecake, cookie dough, Reese&#39;s peanut butter, and the dulce de leche are my top picks. <br><br>The food here is decent but I really just come here for dessert. Though the wheat loaf they serve before food arrives is actually pretty great. <br><br>Seriously go try Linda&#39;s fudge cake here. I just wish parking was easier after 6pm.

Be warned!<br><br>It&#39;s like they picked up this Cheesecake Factory from the dump and dropped it in the heart of Beverly Hills. People should be upset and rioting in the streets over this!!! It does not belong in the 90210. First off, it&#39;s a very small location, terrible parking in the area, and gross inside. It was about a 15-20 minute wait, normal for any of their locations. I tried ordering the Eggplant Parm, and was told they were out. I&#39;ve NEVER been to a Cheesecake Factory and been told they&#39;re out of the eggplant. WTF! Then I ordered a pasta dish and was completely disappointed with it. Our food took super long to arrive. We ordered our dinner at the same time as the table next to us, but got our food about 20-30 minutes after! I won&#39;t hold the server responsible for this because, it&#39;s not his fault. Has to be the management. <br><br>I had just spent 4 days in the field, with very little rest and proper food. Super annoying when you go to a chain restaurant and expect consistency, but it&#39;s nowhere to be found. The slippery floors near their kitchen should be addressed immediately. It&#39;s very slippery to walk on, and you&#39;ll find your chair sliding around when seated. No joke....it&#39;s a lawsuit waiting to happen. I was in such a bad mood, I couldn&#39;t wait to get out of there.
We were having a birthday celebration with several girls, Kevin was the best bartender, taking care of all my girls and respectful. He came by our table after to make sure we were okay.

If you&#39;re in the area and want to eat at the Cheesecake Factory go to the Grove, or find a different restaurant to eat at<br><br>If I could give this a negative rating I would, we were told our table would be ready in a couple of minutes, we ended up waiting 30 minutes for a table of 2 and saw countless other tables of 2 who came in after us get seated before us even when we were told we were next. The waiting area in general is in a really bad position and when every table has to wait and its crowds the entrance of the restaurant it&#39;s not a good look. <br><br>Once we got seated we needed to wait until we went and got the menus ourselves, we also needed to tell the waiter that we were ready to order so we could get served. We watched as the table behind us asked on 4 seperate occasions for the check and had to wait around 20 minutes to get it. The meals weren&#39;t too bad but it couldn&#39;t excuse the disappointing experience we had here.

Ordered takeout dinner for the family.  Got home and one of the main courses was not in the bags.  Called the restaurant and waited 10 minutes as they tried to figure out went wrong.  Said they weren&#39;t sure what happened.  No apology and asked me to come back and I can get the missing course.  They did not really care.  Mistakes happen but they dealt with it very poorly.  Separately at least one of their counter workers was not wearing a mask.  Food was poor to fair.  Will avoid in future.
They have everything on their menu it is a great place to go with a large group of friends or family. Their food and service is good

Just ordered a caesar salad - online it gives you an option to &#34;add Extra chicken (the presumption being there&#39;s already chicken in there - NOPE - $16 for a box of lettuce, parmesan and 5 croutons. Called to explain that their order system is misleading and they put me on hold and transferred me for 15 mins until I gave up. Should have gone to CPK

Have been here a couple times at this specific location. Food is great! People are great! Waiters are great! Overall enjoyable experience! There was an incident when I asked a worker there for more bread who was bring out the bread to people. I asked a few times with no answer as if the bread waiter was ignoring me. Other than that. Perfecto!

This review is only for Dylan Jewell Beverly Hills Manager. He has provided an outstanding service and expressed great attitude.<br>Wonderful, great in every way human being.<br> Thank you, ​Dylan,​ for your kind words! My family loves​ this place because of You!

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite places to eat - usually. I appreciate the generous portions, menu variety and of course the cheesecakes!! However this particular visit to this location left me feeling highly underwhelmed and let down.<br><br>While usually solid in the entrée quality department, tonight was far from solid. First up we had the Buffalo Blasts - ok they came thru pretty well except we did notice the spice wasn&#39;t as noticeable as we have had on other occasions at other CFs. We had literally dunk the blasts in the buffalo sauce cup to get the full kick of flavor - not typical. <br><br>We also ordered up the Fried Shrimp. First time with this entrée and boy it was a miss. The mentioned that the shrimp are butterflied but that actually was part of the problem. Butterflying the shrimp led to the shrimp tasting extremely dry and chewy. The breading wasn&#39;t any help either. A batter dip would have been better. The coleslaw that came with it was tasteless as well. Oh but not to worry about the fries - there&#39;s plenty of those.  <br><br>Next up was the Chicken Enchiladas. Upon ordering, this sounded great - I hadn&#39;t tried these here yet, so I was looking forward to it. Ugh what a mistake. The presentation was very attractive but the taste again was a real let down. Zero flavor and spice to this dish. Yeap - bland Mexican dish. Impossible right? Good amounts of cheese but the sauce and chicken was really below run of the mill. I was pretty surprised. Rice was like sticky white rice with some pesto sauce brushed on it. If I scooped in the rice was actually white in clumps. Uhh not Mexican rice at all. Beans were... well black beans - actually the best part of the meal. No to-go box needed for this plate of leftovers. <br><br>Ok one dish that came thru was the Spicy Cashew Chicken on rice. This was a specialty dish. Good amounts of chicken cooked well. The sauce was nice with a good kick of spice. Plenty of rice - this was a winner. Enough to share. <br><br>Another bright spot was my Pineapple Mojito. It came with a bunch of ice but was made pretty strong, as was the dirty martini we had. Bartender was serving well tonight. <br><br>Of course the cheesecakes did not disappoint. Smores cheesecake was huge with marshmallows and graham crackers on top. The other cheesecake ordered was the Kahlua Cocoa Coffee cheesecake - excellent. Creamy and not to sweet. <br><br>So along the lines of food taste we had two huge strikeouts. I mean I didn&#39;t think The Cheesecake Factory could let me down, but tonight it definitely did. Another blow to the dining experience was the overall cleanliness of the restaurant. We were seated next to the kitchen swinging door and the floor was always a mess. I mean if you got up to leave your table you would be ice skating on the grease on the slippery floor. Later I would see busboys dragging bags or cloth bags of trash across the floor - no doubt smearing the slimy filth across customer&#39;s walking paths. Gross and actually dangerous. I saw several other patron doing the arms out balance dance. <br><br>I was really shocked by the overall experience - especially while dining in the 90210 Beverly Hills restaurant. I have never had such a poor experience at a Cheesecake Factory. Our waitress was fine and had a personality but the dining and food was severely inadequate. Cheesecake was the only reason this was lifted from one star to two.

We had great customer service here, and we were surprised that it wasn&#39;t that loud, even in the &#34;family dining&#34; area.  I always appreciate the expanded Cheesecake factory menu and the staff are so well trained.  We had a very pleasant and efficient server who was great with our 3 year old.  Our neighboring table had a very aggressive and rude father, and our waiter handled himself like a champ, so we were impressed. <br><br>I love the patio here too.  Fun for people watching and surprisingly comfortable.  Parking can be a pain but that is to be expected in this area of Beverly hills, and the wait for seating... was outrageous.  Again though, to be expected.  If you want easy parking and no-line-seating, go to Calabasas!  :)

BEWARE OF MANAGER!!! Very rude and cranky. Try not to ask her any questions she might flip out on you. I think she projects her attitude to her staff because they all seem on edge as well. On top of it all I don&#39;t think she&#39;s good at keeping track of inventory because they were out of everything I wanted to order. Please take a look at photos, I hope this review helps people out. Oh and their food was nasty and cold. Served cold pasta and their grilled cheese is more like grilled bread I couldn&#39;t find the cheese. But the fries were good:)
The food was excellent!! Came in with a few friends and ordered a bunch of food.<br><br>From the beginning to the end our waiter Kevin, A was in the WORST MOOD. He was annoyed

Just ordered the Greek salad for 13 dollars and there was literally like 5 pieces of lettuce a few tomatoes a couple pieces of cheese and 2 olives.  The bottom of the container wasn&#39;t even covered.  I called to complain and the manager Sarah said I don&#39;t control the prices.  Well you do control what&#39;s in it and if the customer is unhappy you should try to rectify it... She didn&#39;t and was just rude!!! I will never order from here again!

So we felt this was pretty low class.  We got here about 30 minutes after opening.   Got seated and ordered salads and ice tea.  Really looked forward to the great, hot brown bread and sourdough bread which is a Cheesecake Factory staple. <br>   Eventually our food came and was dropped by someone other than our server.  When he came by we asked for bread and he said, &#34;There&#39;s no bread, there&#39;s no bread anywhere!&#34; And he left.  That was curious and disappointing.  <br>   The next time he came by, we asked what he meant by no bread.  We thought maybe since we were early on a holiday they were still getting it ready. It&#39;s Memorial Day.  He said there was a plane crash in the warehouse where the bread and original cheesecake was stored.  He added, &#34;What could we do? Stop the plane mid-flight?&#34;<br>   Well, what they could have done is told people coming in there would be no bread and no original cheesecake before being seated and definitely before ordering.  We would have left. Maybe that&#39;s why they didn&#39;t tell anyone?  We heard a table asking for bread near us.  Did they think we wouldn&#39;t notice there wasn&#39;t any?<br>   We said we thought we should get a discount and when the check came, there was no mention or a discount.  We paid $52 for a pretty lackluster lunch of salads and tea.<br>   Don&#39;t think it&#39;s necessary to go back here again.  <br>   Not really up to the Cheesecake Factory standard we had been used to for sure.

Well I&#39;m not big fan of Cheesecake Factory but this place looks really tiny and tables so close to each other. I took Burger which comes with home salad that was bitter and sour same time. Service is ok there but takes time....

One of my favorites Cheesecake Factory in Beverly Hills and have been a regular for over 20 years. After shopping at William Sonoma and L&#39;Occtaine, I was running on empty.  Was across the restaurant and it was close to 2pm and noticed there wasn&#39;t a waiting crowd so I crossed the street and popped in. The hostess, a tall slender elegant Nubian is always very cordial and genuinely nice. I come here infrequently, but she always remembers me and takes a moment to warmly greet, she is the best.  This restaurant is on north Beverly Drive and gets high foot traffic, full of shoppers. The restaurant is always clean and has high turnover so food is relatively fresh. The waiter and servers were all very professional and nice as well. Because of the lovely hostess, waiter and server&#39;s professionalism, attentiveness and friendliness, I&#39;ve increased rating from 2 to 4 star.<br><br>It&#39;s the day before thanksgiving so I&#39;m keeping food intake light and ordered the cup or mushroom soup and the lunch portion of the skinnylicious Cesar salad with grilled chicken sans crotons. The mushroom soup was surprisingly good. Perhaps the skinnylicious option was not a good choice because despite the ample shredded cheese and added fresh black pepper, the entire salad was bland and tasteless. Will NOT order this skinnylicious option ever. The grilled chicken was freshly grilled and was nonetheless edible and should hold me till tomorrow&#39;s Thanksgiving feast and subsequent comma...

I love how they have many vegan options here but they need to be more careful in handling their food. I&#39;ve been to this location a handful of times and it&#39;s always been 5 stars except for this time. I ordered a vegan Cobb salad and when it arrived it looked different to me, mind you I have ordered this salad plenty of times to know how it&#39;s supposed to look like. The dressing was nowhere to be found as I was eating it I quickly noticed the dry and boring taste. Without the dressing you guys know a salad is pretty boring. Anyways as I was eating the salad I taste something gross. I noticed there was feta cheese in my vegan Cobb salad. You guy might be like  &#34;wow big deal&#34; but for someone who&#39;s been vegan for awhile and you accidentally have dairy or meat you know your stomach will be having cramps all night! I quickly stopped eating and flagged down the waiter. I couldn&#39;t eat my food anymore it wasn&#39;t vegan after finding spoonfuls of feta cheese. The waiter took the plate back and didn&#39;t charge me for it. (I only took a few bites anyways before noticing the cheese) so this ruined my appetite. This could have been worse, what if I was allergic to almonds and can&#39;t breathe when I eat them and they were &#34;accidentally&#34; put in my food. This is why chefs need to make sure the ingredients that go into the food is what the customer ordered. I don&#39;t think I will come to this location moving forward.

Haven&#39;t been to this location for dine-in forever so we decided to give this place one more shot.  However the food was ok but the restaurant was chaotic to say the least during dinner time.<br><br>Food wise, just about everything is par and the portions are huge.  We ordered the Thai lettuce wrap and the grilled chicken tostada salad.  The Thai wrap was a great choice and healthy.  I highly recommend it.  We wanted the grilled chicken tostada&#39;s pico de gallo sauce to be on the side instead of tossed, but it didn&#39;t come as we wanted ( though ok. We didn&#39;t mind).  The chicken was rubbery and chewy.  We could have had the tostada salad without the chicken.  It would have probably tasted better.<br><br>This is the first Cheesecake Factory that I came to as a kid, and it used to be busy as well all the time but well managed and organized.  It&#39;s kinda sad to revisit and see this place a chaos with a crowd hovering around the check in table and bumping into each other while the waiters and waitresses can hardly do their jobs right.  <br><br>I am sure the cheesecakes are delish.  We didn&#39;t have any desserts because I pretty much lost my appetite sitting in this restaurant watching chaos flashing right in front of my face between the customers impatiently waiting to get their tables versus waiters &amp; waitresses bring out the wrong charges to the wrong tables....yikes. What a mess!!<br><br>I recommend this place for ordering take outs only.  The dine in experience just ruins the good food that this place has to offer.  Sorry, still 3 stars.
20 minutes for three entree to go. Isn&#39;t the online ordering to expedite quickly orders. Thank goodness for bad news.
Bakery /Takeout is severely understaffed.  impossible to place an order in a timely manner, wait times are unreasonable!
Worst customer service I have ever witnessed.<br>Stay far away from this disaster of a location

I come here all the time but I have never got just amazing service like I have today ! This server has the most amazing personality ever!! He made my day. Thank you Kyshon you have an amazing heart and soul. There should be more servers like you.
The best restaurant ever. Does not matter how many new places i tfy. Cheesecake is home. Is my go to place. Live every item in the menu.  There coffee is a must  the bread fantastic.

The original Cheesecake Factory is on Beverly drive and I have been a happy customer there since 1984, except for yesterday, when I saw the &#34;food quality manager&#34; supervise and manually touch and rearrange food items with her bare hands while holding menus with the other hand and under her arm. When I told the manager she was fast to justify the incident not listening to the menu and under arm part, I kept my eyes on the amount of plates coming out of the kitchen and same thing, salad towers were falling and quickly picked up by the &#34;quality manager&#39;s&#34; bare hands. At that point I had to make a stronger point and mentioned bacteria on menus and bare hands. She finally understood and removed that plate. Okay Cheesecake Factory of my life. Now I know how and why people get stomach viruses  all the time. Not following protocol.

I like Cheesecake Factory. Just not this one (anymore). <br><br>The entry is a choke point straight out of an insurgent terrorist&#39;s wet dream. There&#39;s no sensible way in our out without hip-checking people into walls. Hard. And today I watched someone piloting a double-wide stroller run over a dog&#39;s foot. Twice. (Bonus puzzle: Why was there a dog inside?)<br><br>We got seated at an outdoor table, which was perfect at 6:30pm.<br><br>The food, as it always is, was good. But it was so hard to get it! <br><br>I ordered the Vietnamese fresh rolls (the rice-paper-wrapped things with veggies and shrimp in them), which couldn&#39;t come without onions because they&#39;re already pre-made. Same with the avocado spring rolls. I get it; that&#39;s okay. The standardization in their menu is honestly part of what makes CF so reliably good. <br><br>We didn&#39;t get bread when we sat down, so we asked for it.<br><br>It took a little while to get our drink orders taken, and when the drinks arrived, we asked for bread again.<br><br>After five more minutes, we flagged someone down and asked for bread again.<br><br>When the waiter came to take our order, he mentioned that bread was on the way. He took our order and bread arrived a minute later. In the time it took to bring our basket to the table, they ran out of brown bread; the table behind us couldn&#39;t have any until they brought them a basket...with dessert. <br><br>After our food had taken about 20 minutes to come out, I asked our waiter for an update. He said he&#39;d check. Five minutes later, he brought all the food but the fresh rolls. I asked how a pre-made item could be delayed, and he said it was because too many people had ordered...salads? They came out about five minutes later and were delicious of course--but what the heck is going on at this location?<br><br>I had to ask twice for a water refill. Then my glass sat empty for the second half of our meal. <br><br>We were sitting with empty plates for so long that I had to get up to go ask our waiter for the check. He brought it and I just handed him a large bill so that we wouldn&#39;t have to wait an hour for him to come back to get the money and then another hour for him to give us change. <br><br>Because it was basically a game at this point, I actually timed how long it took him to come back with change. I tried to hold out for 15 minutes, but after 13, I went inside AGAIN to get my change. I saw him counting bills at the register so I came back out to our table. <br><br>Two minutes later--we made 15 after all!--he arrived with the change. At least it was counted correctly. <br><br>Whatever management was running either that shift (6/15/17, dinner) or this entire location needs immediate remedial training from CF corporate. I can&#39;t see myself coming back to this location, and I&#39;m pretty soured on CF more generally. What a bummer.

I want to be clear that the 2 stars regards the waiter that took care of our table. I came to this location Wednesday August 15th around 3pm to celebrate with my close friends my wedding. I had literally just gotten married and my last time there was good, so I thought it could be great to celebrate such a special day at this place.<br><br>The host was great seating us super fast (group of 5 people) inside, you go right at the door and right of the bar, by the mirror close to the window.<br><br>To start with, the waiter&#39;s apron was disgustingly dirty, super ultra dirty. He sounds very impatient and was taking deep breaths as soon as we got to our table. As the table was set for 6 people and we were 5 he wants to take out one silverware and plate (ok with that) however he demanded us to hand the stuff to him in a not nice way.  <br>Then he left breathing deep to get some water to us, he just put the water in a rude way, giving two cups to the same person and leaving one without water. (Ok, big deal you think, but his atitude wasn&#39;t good at all). He brought the bread with one butter, remember we were in 5, then I asked for one more butter and he just shakes his head like &#34;afff, seriously&#34; and brought another butter almost throwing it on us. Then took him awhile to come back to the table to take our order. We order, the food came, the food runners were amazing and friendly, the busser was super nice. The food was good as always. <br><br>My friend asked for a lemonade refill and while he was taking her cup from the table her husband said to him, our friends here just got married, the waiter didn&#39;t even looked at us and just said in a very sarcastic tone &#34;good luck&#34;.<br><br>To end in a great way #butnot, he asked us if we want the desert menu, another friend said no so he gave us the bill, but then one of the guys said, let&#39;s get at least one Cheesecake and some coffee to celebrate the wedding!! So he asked for the strawberry cheesecake and two coffees and the waiter said &#34;you guys said you don&#39;t want desert&#34; then my friend said &#34;I&#39;m sorry that we changed our mind, but we really want some cheesecake now&#34;. The waiter gave us a killer look and left to get our order. He seemed very unhappy that day, after the cheesecake it took him 15min to bring the bill again. <br><br>Summing, the food was amazing but the whole experience wasn&#39;t that good, besides the super dirty apron of the waiter, it was very frustrating the way we were treated in such a special day to us. <br>I hope if we get to go back we won&#39;t have the same service.

Terrible service waiter Kyshon was rude and honestly brought everyone&#39;s mood down if you don&#39;t like working with people maybe look for another job. The food lacked flavor and wasn&#39;t even good  save your money and go elsewhere highly do not recommend they have 3 stars for a reason!

It&#39;s the cheesecake factory! I don&#39;t know how it&#39;s 590 calories, but man it fills you up.<br><br>Cheesecake<br>Don&#39;t do it, you don&#39;t need the calories. Go for a run instead.

Remembering they have large portions, I asked my server if I can have the half portion for the entree pasta and salad I wanted to order . She explained that half portions stop being served at 5pm and that the kitchen could make the half portions but they would still charge me for the full since it&#39;s after 5pm. Fine, so I ordered a full portion pasta and got an appetizer salad and avocado egg rolls instead. A few minutes later the manager comes and informs us they ran out of avocado egg rolls so I had to change my order. Then the server comes back a few mins later and says , oh never mind, we actually do have the avocado rolls. I modified my order 3 times by now. When they brought the complimentary bread out, I asked the server if the bread can be warmed up. I didn&#39;t think I was asking anything unreasonable but she made it seem like it was such a hassle as there is no toaster , but she can put it under a heat lamp if I want although I should rest assure the bread just came out of the oven . I asked for chamomile tea. She comes back and says sorry for the delay, I had to send someone upstairs to get chamomile since they ran out. I ordered two pizzas through Doordash - why is one half the size of the other (by area)?  Also one is missing sausage.  Also the order page said we would get two kinds of bread, and butter with any order.  I know bread doesn&#39;t normally come with pizza, but I did want to try their bread!<br><br>On the bright side, I enjoyed the cheesecake.  My friend thought it was too cheesy haha!

I love this place more than I Love my own mother. the variety, the smells, the perfection you can never go wrong. and must we talk about the bread? that doughy goodness with the butter that is perfection. go and ur stupid if u dont like this place

we stop to eat here while shopping in the area on a very busy time it was long wait so we asked to seat on the bar.  <br>the bartender was very knowledgeable and helpful and took care of us right away. we came with our baby and the other staff members gave us baby&#39;s chair and took the stroller to the back  they even give a treat for the baby which was very nice of them <br>they served our food quickly

It was a late night drive through Hollywood and we found ourselves on Rodeo Drive.  The kids were hungry and we needed food fast before we took on our drive back to our hotel by Disney.  The plan was to stuff the kids with food so they could pass out on the hour drive back.  This is The Cheesecake Factory, so reviewing the food may be a little moot.  The food is always good at every location I&#39;ve been to.<br><br>When waiting at the front, what I don&#39;t like about the location is the very slim hallway you walk through to enter.  It was crowded and there was no other place to wait but here.  We blocked the hallway and had to keep moving around so the waiters could deliver food to their customers.  The wait was long, but this was not The Cheesecake Factories fault.  The front desk guy seemed a little snooty, but it was late and he could have just been tired.  I was a bit grumpy after waiting 15 minutes.<br><br>Finally the front desk guy asks would we be willing to sit inside.  Turns out my wife asked for outside dining (great job babe, we could have been seated a long time ago).  Once we agreed that outside or inside would work, we were seated in minutes.  Once seated, the waitress came to our table quick.  She was very attentive and paid equal attention to my kids.  This won me over FAST.<br><br>I ordered 4 cheese pasta and it was super yummy.  I always order 4 cheese pasta; it&#39;s always super yummy at every location.  My kids ordered spaghetti, they loved it.  My wife had a salad and it was so big she couldn&#39;t finish it.<br><br>There was nothing that was outstanding beyond your normal Cheesecake Factory experience, it is what it is.  I like this place just as much as any location and if I find myself in the area late night, I would eat here again.

First of all - we sat at the bar and the bartender could not have been any awesome-r.  He charged my cell phone, replaced my Diet Coke right as I was slurping down the last drop of the previous glass (hot day of traveling = 4 diet cokes), made recommendations for our protein burgers, and did all this with a fairly busy bar.<br><br>I requested a glass of ice for my Chardonnay and our drinks were in front of us in less than a minute. (I know ice in wine is gauche but I like my wine super chilled).<br><br>So the food was &#34;the Cheesecake Factory&#34; and we went there because we already knew the menu and knew they&#39;d be fairly fast. The food was exactly what we wanted - the bartender should be a trainer for customer service in the food service industry. I hope the Cheesecake Factory recognized they have a stellar employee! Thank you!

What can you say about the Cheesecake Factory? If you are going in expecting three-star Michelin, you&#39;re going to be disappointed. But it&#39;s not an Outback Steakhouse, either. Perhaps because this is the original one (and it&#39;s Beverly Hills) the place is always immaculate and up to date on the decor. There are even some healthier choices for those who want them. The cheesecake is the best- I never swerve from the original. While I don&#39;t eat here all the time ( I don&#39;t think the earth&#39;s crust could bear the weight of me and my car if I did) it is a great indulgence destination. My b-day is coming up and I think I will be indulging again soon..

We came for the Romano crusted chicken breast, left for the bizarrely incompetent hosting staff. OK... I know most of you are going to be upset I gave &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; one star - but, honestly, I would give it LESS if I could! I have NEVER been so disappointed as any CF as I was today. The service was bad (were they trainees??? I don&#39;t know), the food was HORRIBLE... I usually get the same things, so I KNOW what it&#39;s supposed to taste like! That&#39;s one of the reasons to go to Cheesecake Factory! You know EXACTLY how the food is gonna taste! Well, the Chicken Piccata was horrendous. The pasta was dry. The sauce had absolutely NO FLAVOR... I asked the waiter could it be possible they forgot to add salt to the sauce? He said it comes prepared - all they do it heat it up. I asked him to have a manager TASTE IT and let me know what they think. He came back 20 minutes later saying the manager said it was fine. It was NOT fine. I added salt. I added pepper. I asked for crushed red chilies. Nothing helped. And to top it all off, we were still waiting for our bread! I have had bad experiences at this particular location before, so I am not completely shocked. I wish they would send some &#34;checkers&#34; to see how poorly this restaurant is managed. To serve a customer iced tea in a chipped glass - that&#39;s something that the health department does not allow. Why would it be OK? Why doesn&#39;t anyone notice? The guy who washes the dishes? The waiter who brought the drinks? I don&#39;t know. Seems like people are working there and they just don&#39;t care at all. I will never go back to this location. And, it&#39;ll be a long while before I visit another CF.... it honestly left such a bad taste in my mouth.. SAD. Really sad. They better do something to fix this place. If you read this far - thank you. I hope this review helps.

When it says grilled mushrooms and Swiss cheese they fail to tell you they mix it into turkey meat ( which can not be detected at all) to stretch the meat. <br>definitely  not the Resturant it once was.

This place is awesome. I am not sure why people think so low of cheesecake factory. I have been coming here for awhile for a quick bite. I want to mention Sara she is AWESOME and VERY professional. I was with my family and observed this mean lady trying to yell at her and she managed the situation very well. Again great service.

I have been in Cheesecake Factory several time, but today I had bad experience, the waiter was nice and attentive, we ordered some cocktails and appetizers, they arrived on time, but our lunch took more de 30 minutes, people whom got after us , they ate before us,  and we ordered something simple, a pasta and half sandwich. I think the manager got delivered our food and she didn&#39;t  even apologize for the dilated of our lunch. I hope next would be better.

The cheesecake is always pretty good (as in, if you don&#39;t like it, it&#39;s a result of personal preference and not quality) but the food was absolutely terrible. In my experience, CF food is only upper end of mediocre anyway, but this was my worst experience. I got the fillet and it tasted like it was marinated in water and rinsed before cooking. The green beans tasted just as bad. Imagine taking a bite of a big, thick, steak and just tasting water. I took 3 bites out of a huge steak, ate 2 green beans, and 1 bite of mashed potatoes and put the plate on the corner of the table and shared my gf&#39;s plate - which was much more the &#34;upper end of mediocre&#34; described earlier. CF is becoming the Olive Garden of... well, they don&#39;t really have a specific style, but it&#39;s not good. <br><br>Our server was very nice and helpful but it kinda bothers me she saw an entire plate almost untouched on the corner of the table and didn&#39;t bother asking if anything was wrong when she saw it and we declined boxes.

3 days ago i came for lunch to this place.<br>Waited for the Ceasar salad for 30 min and then got it with raw chicken. <br>Really raw! red with blood and the one you cannot chew. <br>I even tried to eat it a little bit.. and paid with a stomachache for that.<br>Definitely don&#39;t recommend getting chicken there.

I should have got the salmon.  When I was a lot younger, I really liked coming here and thought the food was good.  Yes, the cheesecakes and desserts are yum.  However, the pasta/shrimp is just okay.  I got the same dish I always get, shrimp scampi, and it&#39;s probably been about 5 years since I got that dish.  I should always get the salmon when I&#39;m here.  This restaurant is also one of the smaller ones.

The only reason I&#39;m giving this place two stars is because the food was good and the hostess was nice. Honestly the service sucks. If I wanted Cheesecake Factory again I&#39;d go to a different location.<br><br>We waited about 10 minutes to be seated, which isn&#39;t bad. We sat down, and it took our waiter around 7 minutes to come to our table to get our drink order. He didn&#39;t even introduce himself like I have no idea what his name is. He also didn&#39;t check on us that much. We had to ask other waiters when we needed something. He would pass our table and not even ask if we were doing okay. I even saw him standing around instead of checking on his customers. <br><br>I also asked him could we switch to another table because our table was awkwardly placed in between two groups. He told me to go to the front and ask. Out of all the restaurants I&#39;ve been to I&#39;ve never been told to go ask the front after I&#39;ve been seated. I also asked him for bread, and he said the bus boy was bringing it. I&#39;d been waiting for about 15 minutes for bread at that point. Why couldn&#39;t he just bring it to me? I got my appetizer before I got my bread. <br><br>It wasn&#39;t even just us thinking the service sucked. One of the people next to us literally had to get up and give him the check because he wouldn&#39;t come by. You could tell they were getting annoyed. The people on the other side of us were also getting frustrated because he wouldn&#39;t come by when they needed stuff. <br><br>At least the food was good. I had the factory burger. I wish the waiter would have told me that it doesn&#39;t come on a circular bun because it seemed like I got less meat, but it was tasty. My girlfriend got the bacon cheese burger, and she liked it. We also split the calamari and that was delicious. I loved the sauce that came with it.

Ok after all the walking at the Car Show Time to eat. They have outside and inside seating. We were seated and had to ask for bread. A large family came and were all over us so we asked to be moved. Now that we had our own space everything worked out well. Food was ok bf didn&#39;t like his as much.
I&#39;m a huge fan if the Chinese Chicken Salad.<br>We had tiramisu cheesecake!<br>Love it!<br>Not so sweet but great texture!

Sat at the bar for their happy hour, which is pretty good though somewhat reminds me of Chillis/TGIF/Applebee&#39;s Happy Hour.  So pretty corporate and the food is filling.  The portions are really big which is surprising for happy hours so you really do get your money&#39;s worth. Plus, the variety of happy hour menu items is pretty impressive.  The prices are worth coming in for, besides the cheesecake, which are half price appetizers from 2-6 M-F. Beer is $3-$5 and they also have discount wine and well drinks, around $5 too.  Cheesecake is full price though, but is worth treating yourself for saving money on the food.  We got $3 beer (Bud, Bud light, Coors, Miller) southwest egg rolls, and nachos.  I think they had 3 types of nachos offered.  Then we split the vanilla bean cheesecake which is pure decadence.<br><br>Get there early or you&#39;ll have to wait.  The bar area is small and fills up quickly.  The rest of the restaurant isn&#39;t particularly large either.  Parking? Valet or Beverly Hills public parking. Definitely worth stopping by, wish they offered smaller sized cheesecake because it&#39;s so unbelievably rich!

I really enjoy the Cheese Cake Factory food. <br><br>Avacado egg rolls here are amazing, fabulous dipping sauce for them.<br><br>For lunch the Cobb Salad is really good. Love bacon and blue cheese crumbles.  <br>The BBQ chicken salad is delicious too! The crispy fried onions on top are the best!<br><br>For dinner my favorite selection would be Factory Meatloaf! Large portion definitely enough to share.<br><br>White chocolate raseberry cheesecake and the carrot cake are always amazing!

The original first ever cheesecake factory location. Started as just a cheesecake store and then added the salad bar ... and the rest is history. Love the bread - best ever and the price is great - free. Always consistently good food - so much to choose from - perfect.for any palette and their desserts - well it is the cheesecake factory!!  Friday night and no wait after 9.30 - great service and setting is relaxed and stylish. Definitely coming back to this location.

Uh the absolute worst place.  First time here and last time.  I understand that it&#39;s a franchise so it&#39;s about quantity over quality but this is insane.  You guys managed to screw up 6 orders while I was waiting for mine and managed to screw up my to go order along with another lady right behind me.   And what&#39;s worse is the cashiers double checked the orders and could clearly see it was not a Cobb salad but the problem is this location is so busy that the staff in the back are way too stressed and they just start putting anything on the plate and basically don&#39;t care.  This is by far the worst customer service I&#39;ve ever experienced.  Cheesecake Factory is basically a glorified expensive McDonald&#39;s that needs a drive thru so that the orders originally made are easier to complain about and return since nobody really has any passion as this place anymore.  And rather then make my whole order fresh they made my salads fresh but then my artichoke appetizer just sat there getting cold.

This is my second time here. I usually order the chicken and shrimp pasta jambalaya but I wanted to try something different by ordering the chipotle chicken pasta. It was alright. I should have just ordered the jambalaya next time. There is metered street parking in front of Cheesecake Factory so it is convenient. The waiter was attentive, we asked for alot of complimentary bread. Delicious.
Very good Cheesecake. Friendly stuff. Waiter was always smyling and happy. Definately worth going if you want to eat a good cheesecake.

Very bad service. Waited too long to get a table. Waited 45 minutes to get our food and when it arrived we were missing one order. After we asked for the manger then it took another 20 minutes to get the last order

Service was excellent but the food at these places is just too much fried and bread and salt and sugar and portions are heavy.
