I couldn&#39;t get past the starter of avacado spring rolls and ended up bagging my dinner which was a huge waste of money. The place inside is nice but floors are slippery. Staff won&#39;t probably notice since they wear shoes for that but regular customers might want to watch your step since it&#39;s dark lighting. Again, order light if you go.

I&#39;m writing this review for my boss. He usually orders from here and gets take out, however on April 11th he had glass on his first bite of the Cobb salad. After calling the restaurant, they just said they will toss out all the lettuce. Not sure how that will solve the glass in the salad problem..

This location is one block off of Rodeo drive near the fancy shopping.  A good place for a reasonably priced lunch if you are there just taking in the sights.  If you have the money to really shop on Rodeo Drive, though--there are probably better places!  ;)<br><br>There is a close-by parking structure with the first two hours free.  Good enough for lunch and some quick sightseeing in the area.<br><br>The staff was friendly at the Cheesecake Factory and the food was good -- especially the salted caramel cheesecake.  Yum.

Went on a Saturday morning, ordered poached eggs and ham. Took 25 minutes to arrive. The ham was a thin slice of processed supermarket type cold cut, reminiscent of Subway. Somehow, one egg had no yolk. Told waitress who came back with another egg. Tasted the eggs which were inedible due to use of way too much vinegar in cooking it. (It&#39;s normal to use a small amount to keep the eggs together.) I told the waitress, Giuliana who apologized and said she&#39;d let the kitchen know. She did not take it off the check, even after seeing I left them on the plate, unable to eat them. Not even an offer of free desert, which I would have refused anyhow.<br>The service was bad and someone in the kitchen pre-made a batch of bad eggs and put them on the plate. No self respect or pride in their work. Used to go there now and then, but they proved who they are on this last visit. I won&#39;t return. I felt ripped off. My wife&#39;s burger was OK. Not good, not bad, simply OK.

Um... whats wrong with this location? Lets start out with the usually soft and warm bread, it was rock hard and definitely not warm. Then we asked for avocado egg rolls, which they were all out of. <br>We got the spinach dip instead... we should&#39;ve skipped appetizers over all. <br>We had to ask our sever for plates 3 times and nothing. <br>I ordered the shrimp platter for my main.. it was just meh. <br>My friends ordered a pasta and a chicken sandwich both were horrible. We spend 120 dollars. Definitely not worth our money.

This location is really small, and gets really busy, but it is worth it for the service. I applaud the staff for being very patient and accommodating with their customers. The manager Adie is really nice and excels in customer service. Kathy working in the bakery is extremely nice,  and always ensures that my to go order is currently made. <br><br>I&#39;ve eaten here on a number of occasions and the serving staff including Colette and Danielle have been really nice providing great customer service. I tend to try new cocktails all the time there, and Danielle provided me with some great recommendations that did not disappoint.  <br><br>Of course, a cheesecake factory visit is not complete without dessert,  and even if I&#39;m too full I make sure to take it home to go. A few not of my favorites area the oreo cheesecake, the chocolate godiva, the s&#39;mores one (have to eat it fresh though), the original, and the original with strawberries.

Service is so so, I been here for several time but looks like the quality of services are different from each time. Great for today&#39;s<br>Food is good!  Specially for habachi stake and alfredo and pasta carbonara is my favorite!<br>Waiting time is super long, always full of people !

Very good food. I usually order the Miso salmon. It&#39;s sweet and light. I also enjoy the margarita pizza which is amazing. The bread is always a must especially the brown bread. The salmon with mashed potatoes and broccoli also leaves me wanting more each visit. The cheesecakes are unbelievable. However, they do not take reservations which makes it hard to attend with large groups. At times the food also takes a little long but it&#39;s worth it. Just wish they had reservations or call aheads for larger parties.

I am truly discussed with what happened tonight at this restaurant. We were celebrating a friends birthday and we everything was going well, food was great services was great until a waiter came up to us and said, &#34; McDonald&#39;s is around the corner.&#34; I am truly upset and offended about what this waiter said to my party. I have never experienced this at any restaurant. I have coming to Cheesecake Factory in Beverly Hills for the past 10 years and this is unbelievable. Never coming back again!

I have never had such bad service at a restaurant before. Went in with my wife and son on Memorial Day. The restaurant was pretty empty with only a few people sitting at tables. I am there with a 2 year old who is not very patient so as soon as the lady came to take our order (she was the manager saying they were short staffed) we ordered and then never saw the food. After about 45 minutes I walked around until I can find someone to assist us and asked where our food was she said I don&#39;t know, let me check.  I also requested the fries with my impossible burger to be served before my burger. After another 20 minutes they brought out my food but forgot my fries. This is after sitting for over an hour. Then a guy comes to help and says he is our waiter. I asked where my fries are? He says oh, you finished your food do you still want it? I said if you want to comp the food I won&#39;t take the fries bc it&#39;s part of my meal. He said no way and 10 minutes later he brought out cold fries which I didn&#39;t eat. I paid with cash so left the lowest tip my wife permitted me (10%) although I should have left nothing and left. I won&#39;t be returning to this cheesecake anymore.

This place is BY FAR the most unprofessional Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to, and Cheesecake usually one of my favorite restaurants. I have came here numerous times and have held back writing a bad review just because I like the food at Cheesecake so much, but today was the last straw. <br><br>I came here for Mother&#39;s Day with my family and the hostess would not seat my brother and I who were waiting for the rest of my family who was still finding parking outside even though more than half the restaurant was empty. Then when my family finally came inside we asked to be seated on the outside patio and she said it was full, my father literally walked her outside and showed her an Open table after arguing back and forth and she finally sat us. The manager came out and apologized but 15 minutes of our time was wasted, and at the end gave us 30% off the bill, but money is not an issue here, while the manager was nice and didnt charge us full price i would have much rathered pay extra and have a better experience.<br><br>I have had numerous bad experiences here from the waiter spilling a drink all over my clothes, to being charged extra on the bill. <br><br>It is such a shame because the food is truly amazing and most of the staff is very nice but the ones who don&#39;t know what they are doing truly ruin it for the restaurant. I think cheesecake needs to take some sort of training initiative to train their employees better so that they can deal with the business of the restaurant.<br><br>The area is great located on north Beverly drive In The heart of Beverly Hills. There is a 2 hour parking list across the street and meters close by.

I&#39;ve ordered to go many times from this<br>Location and every time it&#39;s been disappointing<br><br>I order the kale and quinoa salad which in house is AWESOME crunchy and yummy and warm.<br><br>When you get to go here I feel like they hate when you order to go because they are so busy and it&#39;s an inconvenience. They have forgetten avocado once and the time before that gave me so little dressing it Barely covered my salad.<br><br>I&#39;ve never actually sat down at this location, but I am disappointed with my to go orders for sure. The fact I had to toss out my salad the last time is saddening as I used to really love CKF for fast yummy food with a great variety!
Very poor service.  Appetizers have taken 45 minutes and is still not here.  Manager is so unhelpful and no apologies.    Not yet resolved.

Can&#39;t believe I&#39;m reviewing this place. I came here with friends, only because the cool jazz bar that we wanted to try down the street, Spaghettini &amp; Dave Koz Lounge, was closed for a private event. Super bummer. We walked by Caffe Roma, which my friend had recommended, but it was SO LOUD and felt like a night in WeHo, when we were friends wanting to catch up and talk to each other. So we came to Cheesecake Factory, which I guess was fine for one of my picky eater friends!<br><br>Saturday night, around 9:45pm, we waited 10-15 mins to be seated. Not crazy like 1-2 hr wait, but come on, on a saturday night so late?! The restaurant was packed. <br><br>Kurt was our waiter, and he was kind of snooty. He kept trying to up-sell things to us, which we hated, like adding on chicken to your salad, adding this or that, etc. And it was in a way where he had that tone of, &#34;Are you SURE you DON&#39;T want to add chicken to your salad? It&#39;s really small.&#34; I really hate when people try to do it to me, especially if they aren&#39;t nice. He always seemed like he was in a rush to do this and that, and it wasn&#39;t for our table either, it was to get back to the kitchen. When he came to the table and gave everyone&#39;s drink except mine, he said Georgia Peach was on the way. When he walked away, my friend said, didn&#39;t you get the Bellini? At this point, Kurt was halfway to the kitchen, and shouted back to us (we weren&#39;t sure if he heard us) - &#34;I MEANT YOUR PEACH BELLINI!!!&#34; It was like he heard us. Very strange. <br><br>On the other hand, we had a super nice bus boy who was very sweet. You could tell that he was very genuine and treated his customers (including us) well. Crazy story - my friend was wearing one of those skirts that zips from top to bottom in the back, and for some crazy reason, it unzipped where you could see her butt. She was leaving for the night, then felt it and sat down embarrassingly, then bus boy came over trying to make it better by saying it was alright, and offering her a napkin. It was so funny, because although he was super sweet, it just made the embarrassing situation even more noticeable. LOL. There was no moral to this story, I just wanted to share it because I thought it was hilarious, and it just shows how nice the bus boy was. <br><br>Anyway, I ordered two drinks:  Peach Blended Bellini, and the Asian Pear Martini. Both were fantastic, except there was probably no reason to card me since it tasted like there was no alcohol in them. They were $9 and $12 respectively, which came out to 21 before tax and tip, which added up to pretty expensive for just drinks, that barely gave me a buzz. I guess, what does one really expect from the Cheesecake Factory though? <br><br>I&#39;m frustrated that I came here, but I were forced to come back because of picky eater friends, I&#39;d probably insist at sitting at the bar, and getting my Blended Peach Bellini. That was pretty good, which is why I give it a 2 stars instead of 1!

Very disappointed with the service. I went in to get just a slice of cheesecake and the girl and guy behind the counteer wouldn&#39;t pay attention to me they were  too busy having a conversation. After waiting for a little  I said excuse me and told her what I i wanted and she said &#34;Huh?&#34; Since she wasn&#39;t even paying attention. I then re told her my order paid her and he handed her my cheesecake. She just stood there having a conversation with someone else and laughing as my cheesecake sat on the other side of the counter. Didn&#39;t even put it in a bag. I looked at her confused wondering if she was going to give it to me or not. After standing for 4 minutes looking like an idiot I just grabbed it and left. I come to this one almost every day after work  and have never had this issue before. Always very nice workers and they always give me a bag and are respectful towards me. If you have a job at least do it then have your conversation . Not that hard. This was disappointing and just thought the manager should know. (January 18th at night)

If I could give this place a 0/5 stars I would. DO NOT COME TO THIS CHEESECAKE FACTORY UNLESS YOU WANT FOOD THROWN ONTO YOU<br>To begin, I thought the service would be much better since we were in an upscale area, such as Beverly Hills. With the insane amounts of fees you pay, I expect 10/10 service. First of all, when we were sat down, the waiter took her sweet time getting to us. When she finally took our order for TWO WATERS, she attempted to walk away, however we had to flag her down just to get her to take our entree order. I understand that the restaurant was busy, however you would think that the waiters would be trained to handle it? INCORRECT. The most appalling part was the fact that when the BUSSER brought us the bread, he basically CHUCKED THE BUTTER ONTO MY BODY. He smeared butter onto my 200$ pants. When my boyfriend approached him for new butter, he rudely told us to ask our water and had the audacity to shove him out of the way. When we approached the manager, he accomplished nothing and did not even offer his apologies. Unless you want to be harassed and your nice clothes ruined, DO NOT EAT HERE. THE RUDEST MANAGEMENT, WAITERS AND WORST SERVICE I&#39;ve experienced in Beverly Hills. We left 10 minutes after and did not eat here. Being harassed is not worth the measly meal you can personally make at home, in addition to avoidance of harassment.
This rating is solely for Trevor. I just called to place a pick up order and he was so enthusiastic and kind. Just a small phone interaction put a smile on my face!
This place is terrible and horrible service don&#39;t come here it&#39;s small and no seating waiting area

Food:<br><br>Ordered the lunch special (soup and salad). Thursdays the soup is Mexican Chicken. Soup isn&#39;t bad, however it is a little spicy, fair warning to anyone, they don&#39;t mention that. <br><br>The strawberry-lemonade I ordered was waaaay too sweet. I have a sweet tooth, so me saying that means something. This is the second time I couldn&#39;t drink my refill because it was soooo syrupy. <br><br>My salad came pre-dressed which normally I&#39;m not a fan of, but this time there wasn&#39;t excessive dressing.<br><br>Atmosphere: Place is clean and music is fine.<br>They do however seat people very close to you despite amble room in the place. <br><br>Service: My waitress seemed extremely stressed and I came right at the opening. I only ordered soup and salad and it took 30 minutes to come out. Took a little long for something so small. Also she was not friendly at all and seemed annoyed at all of her customers. When I asked what the specials were of the day, she said &#34;I don&#39;t know, I don&#39;t work Thursdays&#34;. Although she did ask, she seemed annoyed at having to do so. Service would have dragged this to a 2 star. This is the first time I&#39;ve had service like this.<br><br>Overall: I&#39;ll come again. Just in off periods to enjoy my time

If my history serves me correctly, I believe that this Cheesecake Factory Restaurant in Beverly Hills was the very first restaurant in this great chain!!  I fell in love with The Cheesecake Factory 25 years ago because of this specific branch!  I remember dining at this branch several times with my parents and sister when we came down to L.A.<br><br>It pains me to write this review.  The Cheesecake Factory is my favorite Chain Restaurant.  I became a Cheesecake Factory fanatic after eating here 25 years ago!  Found ourselves in Beverly Hills recently, so I was excited to take my wife and other family members here!  I have to say that this is not the same Cheesecake Factory I remembered.  It was a very disappointing and disheartening experience!!!<br><br>Took me a little while to locate the restaurant because their name is covered by trees.  Finally found them and walked in.  Greeted by the hostess and only waited a few minutes before being seated.  First thing I noticed when we were inside was that this place is small!  Never noticed that before.  They are much smaller than any other location that I have been to even with their being some tables outside.  The restrooms?  Do not recommend using them.  They were dirty!  There is one restroom that is shared by both men and women.  If you go through another door (which most of the employees go through), then you will find a separate men&#39;s room and women&#39;s room.  Both were also not very clean.  ( 2 stars for the ambiance).<br><br>Service was below average.  Our waiter was attentive, but it really felt like he was rushing us to finish and leave.  He never cracked a smile or even introduce himself.  Not what I&#39;m used to when I go to Cheesecake Factory locations.  ( 2 stars for service).<br><br>The food was disappointing as well.  I ordered the Kobe Burger.  I ordered it medium, but it came out well done.  I should have asked for another one, but I did not feel like waiting another 30 minutes because I was already starving.  It was the worst burger that I have ever had at any Cheesecake Factory.  ( 2 stars )<br><br>My brother in law was also not happy with his burger.  He had the Classic Burger.  He said that his burger from Black Bear Diner was much better than the one made here.  ( 2 stars )<br><br>There was some good news, though.  My brother in law&#39;s wife loved the Miso Salmon.  ( 5 stars )<br><br>My wife ordered her favorite which is the Chicken Katsu.  It did not disappoint her.  She said it was as good as the other locations, if not better.  ( 5 stars )<br><br>This is the first time ever that I have not ordered a slice of Cheesecake from The Cheesecake Factory.  I was just so disappointed with everything that happened!!!  Did not want to stay in the restaurant any longer.<br><br>I will always be thankful for discovering The Cheesecake Factory here In Beverly Hills 25 years ago.  I just do not know if I would ever come back here after this disappointing experience.  At least I never had this bad experience the first time I went here.

Don&#39;t go here. Its not worth getting worked up.<br><br>Poorest of the poorest service. <br>Manager Brian Larsen is about he most unprofessional manager I have ever dealt with. Even while mistreating his customers and providing extremely poor service, he gives extreme attitude when confronted with the shortcomings of his staff and operation. I frequent this store, but will no longer visit any Cheesecake Factory for the way Ive been treated here. <br><br>Brian Larsen was willing to engage a shouting match across his restaurant floor to argue with an unsatisfied customer. I&#39;d like to contacted by corporate if at all possible. <br><br>Don&#39;t go here. Its not worth getting worked up.

This is one of the first times I&#39;ve been to a restaurant where there is a separate menu for clean healthy eating!! It made it easier to choose good options sense everything was low in calories. I got the Asian butter lettuce tacos and they were amazing, wasps I ally with the sauces provided. Would return!

Went to have lunch and what a disappointing experience,  There were 4 of us and we were went to eat lunch before doing errands.  <br><br>We were seated, and we got our Menus.  It was some time to get the waiter to come take the order, then 20 minutes to get our food which by that time the food was barley warm.  <br><br>Had i know this was going to be a 2 hour lunch i would have skipped the stop at Williams and Sanoma before lunch.  There was only 2 hours Free at the parking structure.
Where is the zero star option?  This place sucks beyond belief.  Waited over an hour, never got our food, even though it wasn&#39;t busy at all.  Will never go back

I actually loved this location as it&#39;s not as dark at the other ones I&#39;ve been to. Parking was very easy as there was a public parking building across the street.  We had a big party - 11 prior and all the staff members were attentive to our needs. We had a refill of my favorite honey oat bread and as usual very happy with the serving size. This is now one of my favorite locations!

Ok so everything about this place is generally amazing. This is the only location I enjoy going to with my girlfriend (even though we have several locations closer to home) we drive about 30 minutes to get here mainly because of the nice vibe of the outdoor seating.  This is maybe our 20time here and we always sit outside cause like I said thats the main reason we go out not to pay for pasta but to sit outside in a nice atmosphere and eat pasta and simple menu items. The Atmosphere is what makes up for the price in all restaurants thats how it works.  Today We come in and we&#39;re told we have no servers working outside?  They weren&#39;t busy and no one would have lost a leg serving a 2 person table outside. Taking 10 extra steps to bring us food and a drink to make a regular customer happy shouldn&#39;t have been a problem. I just feel like its unprofessional not to let us sit outside at 9pm on a beautiful night.  Very disappointed and I&#39;m not going to call if we can sit outside next time neither am I going to take the gamble and drive there to find out if we can.  Great food great servers great everything but this experience ruined it all for us.

Very nice and friendly staff. Steak was cooked just as I asked and drinks were made in the right proportions! Got the Filet Mignon and a whiskey smash. Definitely recommend coming here at night. Not much of a wait either.

We had a gift certificate for $30 that also came with a free cheesecake, so that was great.  <br><br>The food was decent.  The portions are huge.  We were starving, and there were plenty of options for us.  We went with the &#34;skinny&#34; chicken samosas as an appetizer.  I was surprised at how good they were.  The ground chicken was nicely spiced, and the samosas were crispy (a little too greasy, though).  The cilantro-avocado sauce that came with the samosas was refreshing.  I opted for the combo plate of chicken madeira and steak diane.  Both meats came with some kind of mushroom sauce, and the chicken was covered with cheese.  I didn&#39;t really dig the cheese covering on the chicken, but the mushroom and wine sauce was good.  I asked for my steak medium-rare, but it came out more like medium well.  Either way, the steak needed salt.  <br><br>I also ordered the &#34;firefly&#34; drink.  I&#39;m not sure if it was really powerful or if it hit me harder because I was tired, but it was strong.  It had tequila, blood orange, pomegranate, and prosecco - really interesting and tasty flavors.  We finished the meal with the Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake.  Surprisingly, there wasn&#39;t much of an extreme oreo flavor to it.  There was a gigantic oreo on top of some really thick chocolate frosting.  There were bits of oreo in the middle of the cheesecake.  There were also oreo crumbs on the plate.  I honestly think the regular oreo cheesecake is better.  Don&#39;t get me wrong - this one was good, but it wasn&#39;t what I was expecting.<br><br>The service was mediocre.  Our hostess was visibly overwhelmed, and she kept telling us how busy the restaurant was.  We noticed.  It took awhile for us to be seated.  It took a very long time for me to get my drink.  It took a long time for our food to come out, as well.  She wasn&#39;t apologetic about it, either.  <br><br>Parking is fine.  We ended up parking in a garage on Canon.  It was a $5 flat fee, which wasn&#39;t too bad.  There were several garages in the area.

I haven&#39;t been here in a long time.  This Cheesecake Factory is in the heart of Beverly Hills.  I came here for lunch with a bank branch manager on a Thursday afternoon.<br><br>I ordered the Skinny chopped salad.  My lunch partner ordered the Skinny soft tacos.  The food took a very long time, especially for lunch.  The food was over priced and average at best.

Cheesecake Factory in Beverly Hills has been going dowhill for years but today was the worst. Service was sooo slow probably because they had customers ( it was a holiday) &amp; they&#39;re not used to having a lot of customers anymore.  I ordered almond crusted salmon salad for $15.50. What a joke! The piece of salmon was as big as 1 finger. The salad itself was teeny tiny and I had to wait at least a half an hour for it! Apparently they&#39;ve either really cheaped out or they ran out of food. ( BTW that&#39;s happened before.) My friend ordered the salmon lunch plate. She was even luckier than me. Her salmon was totally raw inside so she got to wait an extra 10+ minutes while they cooked another piece for her. In other words, we ate in shifts. Not the way to &#34;have lunch together.&#34; The <br>manager did her best to fix things but the whole experience was so bad that we couldn&#39;t wait to get out.
Yummy<br>Great service<br>Always recommended their shrimp angel hair dinner, will run you more than $20 but worth it<br>Enjoy their different types of lemonades!! :)

Not up to standard with other locations. Nope, nope, nope.<br><br>We ate here because we planned poorly during our shopping trip, and because all the other restaurants had long waits, CF was a good option because we could sit right down. First thought was, &#34;WOW. This place is TINY.&#34; It should seriously be re-billed as Cheesecake Factory Express. It simply is not as spacious and accommodating as other branches, and one restroom for the whole place? Really?<br><br>The food was standard, even though the prices were extra hiked to account for the location. We also had one of those lame servers who treats everyone like a tourist and himself like he&#39;s special. Do you know what I mean? We aren&#39;t here to see you, guy. Here&#39;s hoping you get your call-back to whatever game show you&#39;re auditioning for this week. Sheesh.<br><br>So yeah, not terrible by any means, but yes, we have had better.

I normally like Cheesecake Factory. When I lived back east, it was a Saturday regular ritual in suburbia. <br><br>For what it is, I enjoy it - but not this location.<br><br>A bit cramped. You could barely move without feeling the need to excuse yourself with the tables next to you. And while the french country salad and the chicken samoosas were just as usual - delicious - the fish n chips were so oiley I failed to finish half of a lunch portion. It was literally drenched in oil and barely edible. The lettuce wraps weren&#39;t up to par either. Chicken, dry and overcooked and also - not finished, but for the first time it wasn&#39;t because of the ridiculous portions.<br><br>So while it was probably my first bad meal at a Cheesecake, it was certainly my last meal at this one.

This one &amp; MDR are the best locations over the last 20 years. <br><br>Sit at the bar if you dont want to wait for a table. <br><br>Portions classically large. Sharable. <br><br>Apps are dinners in themselves. <br><br>Lots of Classic CCF dishes we love, but some recent menu changes have proven worrisome. :/<br><br>Note: Cheesecake serving slices have definitely gotten smaller over the years.

This location disappoints every single time. As many times I try to give them a chance, there&#39;s always something that goes wrong. The food is so bland here no matter what you order. The service is by far the worst. The girl who answers the phone for takeout is lazy to talk. I&#39;m not sure how she always messes up orders as well. They either need new phones or a better system. I&#39;m not expecting a VIP treatment at a Cheesecake Factory but considering their location and the reputation other locations hold, this specific one is horrible.

Honestly, pretty meh. <br>We came here for a late lunch around 1:30pm on Sunday. I did expect a wait, after all, this is Cheesecake Factory. And if I&#39;m not mistaken, this Beverly Hills location is the original.  <br><br>The woman at the front was bustling and trying to take names, and continuously keep track of which tables were available. She told us it&#39;d be a 15 minute wait, but it was more like 30. Not her fault, she was very diligent, but I wish she gave us a more accurate time estimate. <br><br>When we were seated, our server came by and asked what we&#39;d like to drink. He brought us our water, and fortunately told us bread was on the way. I was absolutely famished and relieved at the sight of sourdough and honey wheat bread with butter on the side.  Lukewarm, but still very good. We ordered and waited a while for our food. <br><br>As we waited I looked around the restaurant. It was cozy, and much smaller than other Cheesecake Factories that I&#39;ve been. The design of the place seemed simpler too. The walls were still shades of brown, yellow, &amp; orange tones that are familiar to Cheesecake Factory, but there weren&#39;t as many intricate and elaborate designs on the walls or of the decor. Just compare this to the Cheesecake Factory, at say, the Grove and you&#39;ll see what I mean. It&#39;s not a bad thing, just something I noticed. <br><br>I noticed we got our food fairly quick at this location, so that is a plus. However, the food was disappointing. I got the Texan rolls which were basically oily fried eggrolls in a weird green sauce that had a bit of hot sauce in it. The way the hot sauce was added to the green sauce made it look like it had been dropped in there by accident which turned me off a little. Kinda gross. The sauce had a pretty weak flavor overall. <br><br>A pretty lackluster experience which was made worse by an annoying bratty little boy who obnoxiously laughed and yelled and took pictures of everyone in the restaurant. Call me a bit heartless, but one can only take so much of a little boy going up to one&#39;s table and taking pictures of the people there, very up close. It gets annoying after it&#39;s gone on for an hour and a half. Not the restaurant&#39;s fault, the waiters seemed annoyed with him too, but it really ruined the experience for me even further. Definitely not coming back. <br><br>So factors of the long wait, annoying brat, lackluster food, and blah experience contributed to why I didn&#39;t think the food was worth the price (standard pricing for all cheesecake factories, but I usually don&#39;t have a bad time) and why I gave a bad review. Sorry! Won&#39;t be back!

If you are already there checking the reviews for what to order---it is ALL good..the Thai salmon is so good it is worth going back for that alone!  I only took a star off for the crowding of the tables.  Very small place crowded with too much furniture. We were seated in the front window area so maybe next time I will see if we can get a booth.  We Ubered over so we did not have to deal with parking issues in Beverly Hills. They don&#39;t take reservations but there was no line when we arrived (6pm) and we were seated right away!  The tables are so close together that you could hear the conversations of the tables next to you.  There was no private conversation.  People at the next table would chime into our conversation....or ask what we were eating.  We tried the recommended Long Island Tea and it was so good, I had a 2nd.  One was enough.  Very potent and tasty drink.  My guest also tried their signature martini.  The food -- my guest had shrimp pasta and I had the Thai (sweet) salmon.  All top quality with beautiful presentation.  OMG the best salmon I have had!  We indulged in cheesecake but shared one  as they are so big and full of bad calories/fat.  Portions were generous.<br>Although the food was outstanding, it was a bit pricey and I don&#39;t think I will return here because of the crowded seating.  You really felt you were sitting at a long table with a bunch of strangers, closer than comfort. If I am going to pay that high a price, I want a better atmosphere with more than six inches between tables!

I usually enjoy dining at the Cheesecake Factory, but between the dry Jambalaya pasta and the rude wait staff I will definitely not be back to this location. The only saving grace from my experience was the bar having ginger beer in stock to soothe our aching tummies, as well as the delightful hostesses.

Last Friday, my friends and I decided to eat out and we opted for Cheesecake Factory in Beverly Hills. It was packed full of people, nonetheless to my great amazement we found a place to sit. The decor was modern, nothing out of ordinary. I liked it as it was not overwhelming. However, what surprised me the most was the lightning. As I see it, the room was simply too dark, maybe marvellous for a date but not for an agreeable meeting with friends. <br><br>The worst thing about the restaurant was the service. I totally understand that they had plethora of customers, nevertheless we expected something much better. We waited for the waiter for almost 40 minutes. Fortunately, the staff was immensely polite and friendly, trying to make up for the poor and slow service.<br><br>The cream of the crop - food, was amazing. I opted for lasagna verde, which to my mind was exquisite and perfectly prepared. All the ingredients mingled together to create this mouth-watering dish. The spinach pasta was cooked al dente, just as it should be. The filling and tomato sauce were just delightful. All in all their lasagna is too die for and if italian food is your cup of tea, you should definitely give it a go. <br><br>Overall, our experience at Cheesecake factory was unforgettable and I strongly recommend this restaurant to anyone if favour of pastas. But for my diet, I would go there everyday to pig out on this lovely and palatable lasagna.

Nice crusty bread, although too small a serving for 4 people. Great Sodas $3.50. TIP: Lunch special prices are the same prices as regular priced items. Cafe mocha $4.95 was fine. Appetizer Crispy Crab Bites are a miss and not worth $7.95. Avocado Toast $9.95 is intentionally served on the wrong bread being too thick for a dab of avocado and to elastic to bite away (How else can they charge $9.95 for 2 ounces of avocado dip.). Hamburger $12.50 was good but make sure meat is cooked the way you ordered it. Skinny turkey burger $12.95 very good. Skinny chopped salad $13.95 was a miss and should be avoided. Vegetarians should not eat here. All salads and sandwiches have meat or poultry. The waiter volunteered to delete the protein in the dishes with no reduction in price. If you want to add a protein you pay more, consequently if you forgo a protein why not reduce the price? ADA impossible. Can be too loud at times. During a waiter change there was no instruction to the next waiter about which table received which orders.  Our food went to TWO tables before it came to ours. There is a lot for this over blown management to fix (Especially, when they have BOTS responding to their Yelp reviews.). Good luck to them.
Food is always great here. Prices are extremely cheap and served in great amounts. Recommended for dinner and lunch. Usually crowded.

3 star for the desserts only. <br><br>Never enjoyed the service here. Food is tasty and often comes with huge portions, but also along with the calories. On the other hand if you go with healthier options like skinnylicious menu, everything is pretty bland. That makes you wonder they don&#39;t know how to cook good food without making it wildly unhealthy. <br><br>There&#39;s oftentimes wait here during peak times.
Love this place! Pretty large portions, so usually you can share. Delicious food. So many options! Highly recommend.

Service was slower than molasses. We sat down for 12 minutes before any waiter came by to acknowledge us, asked us for our drink orders. It was not busy at all at 5:30pm. We got the &#34;message&#34;, and can see that certain skin colors have better service, although waiter acted nice and we saw him standing around. We also saw that a table of 3 Asian tourists had a very hard time getting a waiter. Send in a &#34;Mystery Diner&#34; to evaluate and see for yourself, just like the grocery industry has &#34;Mystery Shoppers&#34;. <br><br>I still left 20% tip, hoping that kindness will reduce racism, one at a time. If there are perceptions that certain races do not tip, then they should be educated about tipping, but do not conclude that all people are the same. I felt compelled to bring this issue in the open, so we are honest with each other. <br><br>The food was ok, not bad, but also took long time to come out. The food was about the same as in 1994 when I first went to Cheescake in Marina Del Rey and 2002 in Pasadena. Popoular menu items and portions have not changed after all these years.
Cheesecake Factory is great, this one in The Grove has a amazing view in a beautiful location.... not much to say more about this one, just suggest The Jamabalaya.... for southern food lovers.

Always been a fan of Cheesecake Factory, just not of the service. I have yet to find one with awesome service. Sherman oaks, Topanga, the Grove and even here are missing one thing-service! I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s because this place always gets packed, or service isn&#39;t priority here but I honestly get better service as Fridays than any Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. I always feel like it takes forever to get the check. Refills on drinks are not a priority here. If you ask for a second refill on the bread basket, you get looked at like OMG. Yes sorry not so sorry, I love this place and the bread! I&#39;m sure we all love it. :)

I came in for lunch on 12/5 Monday around 2pm. The restaurant was quite dead. I waited at the host podium for a good 15 minutes alone. No one acknowledging I was even there and waiters walking by me not saying a word. <br>Once our host sat us down, we asked him for a booster seat which he never brought to us.<br><br>Once we sat down our waitress came to greet us. Overall experience was mediocre. We had to ask for refills of drinks and wave the waitress down as she was not coming to check on us. <br>Food was mediocre as well. <br><br>Also the bread they bring at the beginning was hard and felt old. I usually love that bread! <br>We were very bummed with the whole experience as we love to go to the cheese cake factory and wanted to try out the one in Beverly Hills during our vacation.

Ugggggghhhhhh the food was super gross because my shrimp was super chewy and my server kinda sucked I literally had to wave him down so I could order a drink and he never checked up on us during our meal

Who doesn&#39;t love the Cheesecake Factory? Even when the service is a little fickle, the food is still FANTASTIC!<br><br>Well, this Cheesecake Factory is no exception. <br><br>We sat at the bar on this occasion as I love to watch the amazing US bar staff in action. <br><br>The barman was amazing (so good I have him a 30% cash tip). <br><br>I had the spicy cashew chicken and it was awesome washed down with one of my favourite beers Blue Moon. <br><br>The service was fast, polite and efficient. The service from the kitchen to us was so fast the plate was still sizzling. <br><br>For great food and service stop on in.
Terrible customer service and out of several dishes. Management was not helpful when approached and had a take it or leave it attitude.
I know what I&#39;ll get here. Menu is good and extensive. Hadn&#39;t been here for a while but it&#39;s nice to visit again

Everytime we go traveling, I always ask my Husband to take me to a nearest Cheesecake Factory, I am a huge fan of Cheesecakes and definitely they never disappoint when it comes to service. Well, I guess there&#39;s always a first time for everything. First, Philip our server just pretended we do not exist in the restaurant whatever reason he might have wether we do not look fancy to be in Beverly Hills or just plain he doesn&#39;t want to be our server, didn&#39;t give us water to start but when he finally did, he only put two glasses which we were 3adults in the table, No crayons or even a Water for my toddler, NO ANTICIPATION at all, serve our food scattered and NEVER check on us in our entire stay and took 10mins to give the check. Second, Dillon the Manager on duty just doesn&#39;t want to hear it, didn&#39;t listen what was the real issue but instead just offer us to take cheesecake totally not a guest service resolution for the experience they offered. Definitely not going back and Never will recommend to anybody.

This Cheesecake Factory location is probably the least busiest Cheesecake Factory I have ever encountered! I walked right on in on a Friday night, no wait!   Granted that it is located in Beverly Hills and most people would go to nicer restaurants, I believe Cheesecake Factory is one of the more family friendly options in the vicinity.<br><br>Parking - Cheesecake Factory valets for $7 which is ridiculous! If you are coming after 8pm, look for free metered street parking or you can find free lots a block or two down.<br><br>As for the food, it&#39;s the typical Cheesecake Factory food.  I am fan of their Chicken Marsala dish.  I&#39;m not a big cheesecake person, but their Mango Key Lime Cheescake is pretty good! Tip: At the end of your receipt, look for a survey, I got a $10 ecard for filling it out!  The cliente is pretty mixed - date nights, families and kids.<br><br>If I am ever in the mood for the Cheesecake Factory, I am definitely coming to this location!

Although this place is been around forever, it still maintains the professionalism, good service and quality food items that you&#39;re familiar with.<br><br>You should ask for the skinny licious menu so you don&#39;t have to eat 1,000,000 calories! It&#39;s just as good just a more healthy version.  We tried the chop salad and veggie salad and the turkey avocado sandwich all delicious.<br><br>Kids menu has a very generous spaghetti and meatballs is also served with a nice drink.<br><br>Sitting on the patio on Beverly Drive is always fun for people watching.<br><br>Thanks to Philip for a great attentive service! (Support staff like the busboys seem a little bit slower and don&#39;t respond directly to customer requests.
Meal was fine, the Strawberry Cheesecake tho <br>Better than everything else in the world.
Amazing food. However, recently the quality has dropped a bit. It feels like the dishes are pre-made and placed in oven to heat up when customers order.

I come here quite often and there is no better server than Dante!! He always has great energy and knows how to give his guest a great experience, never a dull moment with him (: To bad I haven&#39;t seen him the last couple of times, I hope he didn&#39;t quit or get fired LOL. The food is usually good (if it doesn&#39;t take forever) but a lot of the staff act like they don&#39;t want to be there and it shows in their service. I would give them 5 stars if the food was consistent and fast and all the servers had great energy but in general it is usually worth a trip.
Can&#39;t make reservations at this location but thankfully the wait is never that long. With so many options, how does one Not enjoy this place???!

I&#39;ve only ordered take out from this location but their service is superb! I always order for our group at work which is not easy as we all like to substitute things on our dishes. They have always accommodated the additions or substitutions on the dishes. AND they&#39;ve yet to get the orders wrong. Kudos to their take out people AND the kitchen staff.<br><br>My favorite dish is the louisiana chicken pasta, minus the veggies. Who needs vegetables to ruin a pasta dish lol i recently tried their anniversary chocolate cake cheesecake and my goodness it is delightful. It seemed to be a bigger slice than the regular cheesecakes sold too. I could be wrong though but it did look bigger.

Not impressed. I came here for dinner, thank goodness it wasn&#39;t for a majorly planned Valentine&#39;s dinner. I would have been disappointed. I am shocked that this location would be so ghetto. It was smaller than most Cheesecake Factory restaurants that I have been to, half the employees looked sloppy, were too loud, and not very clean cut, and the environment just felt very stuffy. <br><br>The food was good but the atmosphere was very disappointing. It kind of reminded of being in an unfamiliar city or state at a restaurant that was trying to be nice but isn&#39;t really that nice. <br><br>You would think with this being the Beverly Hills location that it would be at the top of the charts.<br><br>The service was fake. Not genuine at all. Very dry energy. There was one point when he came to the table on his way to the kitchen and said &#34;Everything ok here? Ok good&#34;. He never stopped at the table. He just said it as he walked by.<br><br>If you can stand the wait, I&#39;d say go to the location at the Grove. There are plenty of shops and sights to see while you wait for your table to be ready.<br><br>I hope this review helps you decide on where to go for dinner! :)

I learned that this was the first cheesecake factory.  I went here in the 70&#39;s as a kid and remembered ordering pumpkin cheesecake which I found way too rich.<br><br>Today we went in at around 2:00 PM and had no wait (which I always find rare in most cheesecake factories)  We had a nice big table.  Service was very good.  I was happy to see they have a lower cal menu because I saw all those horror stories about their dished being a billion calories.  I had a skinny burger and salad.  My gf had a turkey burger with salad. <br><br>We split a slice strawberry cheesecake which was not too rich.
Exactly as you&#39;d expect. Good food in good portions. Tables are a touch too close so go off peak.

&#39;this location suckssssss, big time.&#39;<br>I don&#39;t know who the &#39;to go&#39; section think they are but every time i pick up whoever is on duty SUCK!!! Excuse my French of that I am part of but I cannot refrain my anger with this place tonight, Mon.10th July 2017.<br>Customers take note what I&#39;ve seen while awaiting a pick up order.<br>I have seen staff swipe spilt fries back onto plates with their bare hands.<br>I have seen food plates returned to kitchen counter for whatever reason get swiped onto another order e.g broccoli, potatoes, and don&#39;t get me started on how the bread is grabbed and just dumped into baskets.<br>I have seen food orders reheated. e.g a plate of shrimp scampi was returned, apparently cold and it was thrown into a pan to reheat and use for another order.<br>I have seen cooks drop stuff on the floor behind kitchen counter and pick up and use without cleaning.<br>I saw a server sneeze/cough over food.<br>I have seen a cheesecake decorator lick her fingers.<br><br>But what got to me tonight is being lied to and then lying to.<br>I clearly asked a woman in the pick up corner for a order. She clearly said, it isn&#39;t quite ready yet.  I txt the person who ordered and she&#39;s upset cos she was told her order was ready 30mins ago. I hand the phone over to the lady who I spoke to and she tells the person the order has been ready.  So, here we go ...<br>We get into it and the woman at Cheesecake Factory pushes the order to me and that was it.<br>The nerve of this woman, at &#39;to go&#39; section to lie to me and the person who ordered didn&#39;t surprise me cos ive heard workers in this section make up lies to customers picking up or ordering. And this was the last time for me. <br><br>I&#39;ve waited at sugarfish locations up to 1hr to 1hr15mins but at least the staff keeps it real with you on wait time.<br>The only reason this location has customers is bcos it&#39;s the least expensive place in Beverly Hills with big portions and a semi ok menu for a average price range when your trying to eat out with a family but not spend $500.<br>Check your utensils, plates and cups people. I&#39;d question the sterilization of everything at this location. <br><br>The cooks can&#39;t keep up with the pace of orders and customers need to be told the truth of wait time that is 45mins from time of order when place is busy and not lied to that the crappy food has been ready.  Ridiculous.<br><br>HIGHLIGHT: The host section and the bar section is the only organized and friendly staff you come across. SO, if anything eat at the bar, you&#39;ll always be pleased with the bartenders on duty.<br><br>By the way, I have the name of the lady from Monday night.  I&#39;ll be courteous enough to not call you out woman but mark my words, one day a customer will go off at you on site. Your too much of a liar and idiot for my time to waste.<br><br>This location needs a health inspector to walk in random to review. And that&#39;s where my complaint on Yelp is going.<br><br>Tourists/visitors/locals go to another location or pay a lil more to eat clean well prepped and made food.  Better than the rubbish served at this CFactory. I will never go to this location ever again.  And from the low star rating by many on Yelp I&#39;m not the only one.  Ive only ever stopped by because it&#39;s the closest location to my location.  It use to be a cool handy spot so that one could enjoy site seeing after eating.  Now it&#39;s CRAP!<br><br>Please note: guest services do not attempt to reach out on my review cos I&#39;ve seen that&#39;s all you do but no changes are made.  <br><br>#can&#39;tstopwon&#39;tstop

It was my first time at the location. Overall I&#39;m happy with the service and the food. The price is reasonable and the employees are very friendly. <br><br>The only problem I had was the floors were dirty and slippery. It felt like I was going to fall everytime I was walking.

This review is in regards to delivery orders.  I have only ordered delivery through Doordash from this location.   Anytime I have requested something in the comments, it is never given.   For example, please include ranch instead of bbq sauce or something like that.  It&#39;s just ignored.  So I ordered the Cajun Chicken Littles which comes with chicken tenders, mashed potatoes, and succotash and normally a side of BBQ sauce and Honey Mustard.  I asked for Ranch instead which was ignored, of course.  I even called and spoke to the girl organizing to go orders and she said that she saw my request on the order and would make sure I got it.  Normally, a missing ranch sauce is not cause for a poor Yelp review, but this time they took it a step further and just sent chicken tenders in a container with no sides at all.  So I call and get the same girl who tells me her manager is checking all of the to-go orders and that the order was confirmed with the Doordash driver and then puts me on permahold until I just hung up.   So I got some bland chicken tenders with sauce I don&#39;t eat and no sides and not even an apology for the mistake.  Last time I order from this place.
The Cheesecake Factory is a great spot for desert! Love their cheesecakes and they have plenty to choose from. Love coming here! They are prompt with service

Normally, I am pleased with the food here, but the food I ordered today was beyond disgusting!! I ordered fries and cheeseburger spring rolls (they looked great in the pics online). The fries were old and cold which irritated me to no end!, Second, the cheeseburger spring rolls were out of this world disgusting!! They were soaked in grease and when I say soaked in grease, I mean they were Michael Phelps swimming in grease! That wasn&#39;t the only issue, they were totally tasteless, bland, without life, like Professor Binns (Harry Potter fans will get the reference). I don&#39;t know what the heck is going on with Cheesecake Factory but the quality of food is subpar. REALLY SUBPAR!!

This Beverly Hills location is the first Cheesecake Factory, ever. The layout seems a bit strange, and from what we were told it&#39;s because the restaurant was half the size and they took over the space next door. The food is consistently good from location to location. One person from our party had to wait expecially long for her food, our waiter made sure to keep her updated on the status and offered her a salad which we thought was great. Friendly staff. Parking across the street for  $5 or valet out front (didn&#39;t see the price).
I love Cheesecake Factory! The best food. So fattening but it&#39;s sooooooooo good!! I love the chocolate cheesecake there. It&#39;s my favorite.
Great Food, Great Servers, nice place....oh and the cheese cake rocks....negative...kinda small I like others better!

Well, all honeymoon&#39;s end. We are neighbors and patrons for over fifteen years. This was essentially our kitchen for the last few years. Generally, while inconsistent the past couple of years, there has been no major complaint. Tonight, well, was down the tubes and our swan song.  <br><br>My wife&#39;s turkey avocado sandwich came with no bacon, a skimpy bit of turkey, no avocado and ice cold. When sent back, it took &#34;forever&#34; for it to return (we all finished our meals before it returned). The &#34;manager&#34; A.E. came over to try and say it was correct, but after a small &#34;discussion&#34;, apologized and acknowledged the order was wrong (the server never did). A.E. offered to do it again or comp it, along with a hot fudge sundae (appropriate). No hot fudge sundae ever arrived. When my wife asked A.E.about the lost sundae her response was &#34;I didn&#39;t say I&#39;d comp that.&#34;  Huh? We heard it. It&#39;s one thing to make an offer - another to dodge the issue. We&#39;re done. Patrons who stand in line may not take notice here, but management should put some more effort in their training.  Plenty of other places to eat in BH for residents.

My love brought me here for my birthday June 15 and it was really nice very busy due to it being father&#39;s day so the wait was about 35 min to be seated, I really like the decor,ambiance,with the murals above really nice restaurant. Food was delicious I had the Jamaican peppered shrimp,rice,black beans with the side of mango salsa that sets it off yum. At the end they sang happy birthday which caught me off guard (bf used the using the restroom to inform them) lol it was all good though I would love to eat here again. Note:Atl has them beat on ambiance and decor more well lit.

Came here with my mom - We got sated in such an awkward table in the middle of a room.<br><br>There are no bag hooks and not much room to put any of my purses down except on the floor ( which is not a good idea for Hermes ).<br><br>I ordered just two appetizers - The Spicy Ahi Tuna roll : It was really filling but oily.<br>                                          - Fried Calamari : It&#39;s unquestionably the best I&#39;ve tasted in Beverly Hills so far. <br><br>I also ordered a shake, which if you cannot finish it you can take it home, but the container that we had to take it home in was super dirty eeek!
I love cheesecakes and this is my favorite cafe with desserts. The atmosphere is very cozy and staff is nice. Recommend it to every cheesecake lovers. But it is always very busy there

We went there for dinner on Sunday.  Horrible service!!  Waiter didn&#39;t even approach the table for over 10 minutes.  Food took forever to come out for the whole section, excuse was that a party of 16 had come in.  Both orders were incorrect and when the waiter realized it, he offered to get my husband the pasta he selected.  That alerted the female manager, who came to our table to see what was wrong.  She decided the best way to handle the situation was to blame my husband for ordering the wrong dish!!  Seriously???!!  Where did she go to management school!!  Then it got worse - she wouldn&#39;t allow the corrected order to be completed!  On the way out, my husband spoke to the other manager on duty, he just listened and didn&#39;t offer any alternative solutions.  We will not return to this place.

Don&#39;t ever order take out, worst service. They don&#39;t even tell you they&#39;ll be with you in a minute. They just leave the counter. I don&#39;t know about you but I don&#39;t want that kind of service. Why can&#39;t the food quality match with good service?

I was not a fan of everything  on my most recent visit here. Food and drinks were good (love the tex-mex eggroll appetizers) however service was lacking. The waiter was hurried and disinterested and coming to the table a few times and going &#34;need another cocktail?&#34; does not equal good service.<br><br>Cheesecake was bomb!

Great fish and chips, but  really less than two ounces of wine in a glass.  <br>Other times I&#39;ve been there food is just above average.  The portions are huge. <br>Salads  are hard to screw up so they are fairly good.<br>I had the Steak Diane and it was a tough cut of steak. <br>But the cheesecake and other desserts are excellent.<br>And they pour a lovely glass of wine.

Let&#39;s start off by saying we had to wait exactly 1 hr 23 mins for a pasta, plus it was cold. My nachos was a appetizer and it was not good at all! Our waiter was very nice and offered to bring their manager. The manager came to our table and didn&#39;t give a shit. We came on a Saturday night and I get them that it should be busy but that means that they need more chefs. We also got a impossible burger, a miso salmon,avocado egg rolls, and a fish tacos. Those were not worth the money. All 7 of us had diarrhea 30 mins after the meal. Please hire more chefs due to customer service. This does not meet my standards. This is a family restaurant not a boring place that serves cold average food. We had some tourist with us and this was very embarrassing to me. I don&#39;t think I will ever come back!!! I don&#39;t recommend it for people that expects high standards. I have witnessed multiple other tables have the same issue. I have a bunch of other restaurants that is better. #notcomingback #coldfood
Great food, great service what more can i ask for. Perfect for a night out twith the girls sip a little wine and cheesecake. Highly recommend it guys!

Went here for a late lunch today and got a table for four with almost no wait.   Service was great and food good was good as usual.  Ordered from the lunch special menu and was impressed with the value.  Had a Reene&#39;s special which comes with sandwich, soup and salad all for $12 bucks!!   If you want something even more robust go for crusted chicken Romano.

I&#39;m a very disappointed in The Cheesecake Factory this year around. I have been a loyal customer to this chain for the past 10 years, most of my visits being to the one in Chicago. Either way, I&#39;ve had almost everything listed in that menu book and a majority of the cheesecake flavors as well.<br><br>I always attend half off cheesecake day, stocking up on a few great flavors/slices. I clearly remember in the past being able to go to the takeout counter and order multiple slices.<br><br>This time around, 1 hour before closing on the last half off day, I was told I can only order one slice per person. But first, I waited in line for about 20/25 minutes picking out cheesecakes / asking my friends over the phone which slices they wanted. It&#39;s finals week at school, some people just don&#39;t have time to make it out here to get their own slice. So being the nice friend, I took orders to bring it back to them.<br><br>By the time I reached the counter, I am told only one slice per person. Now, I have 7 orders currently waiting to be fulfilled. I asked him why I couldn&#39;t get more than one slice and he kept saying &#39;only one&#39;. I then go talk to the host about this issue and then a manager. After asking them why they didn&#39;t want my service / money for these seven cheesecake orders, I still got the &#39;one per person&#39; speech.<br><br>HOWEVER - My friend went 3 hours before me to get cheesecake to go as well. She was able to bring home multiple slices; the man at the front even asked her if she wanted any more slices to go.<br><br>Walking into the restaurant, I see a man coming up with two large to-go bags filled with only cheesecake to go boxes. One man... about 10 cheesecake boxes.<br><br>Things just don&#39;t add up and I am very disappointed and angry at The Cheesecake Factory. Right now, I&#39;m not sure if I will ever be a returning customer here - as well as my family and 6 friends who wanted those slices.

Last week, we celebrated a family birthday at their Redondo Beach location. Everything was great, that&#39;s why we went back this weekend at the one closest to us for a good burger.  The food came fast but the service was very poor. It was a short wait for a table on a Saturday night. But it&#39;s the little things like not getting bread while waiting for our food unlike other tables and not refilling our water or drink. I was so upset, I had to talk to the manager so that it won&#39;t happen again to another customer. One would expect more attentive service in Beverly Hills. :( *see Redondo Beach CCF review

Had a great lunch with my friend on a Tuesday afternoon! <br><br>Went on a Tuesday afternoon around 1pm. No wait, we were seated right away. <br><br>Bread basket came out fresh and hot. Everyone loves Cheesecake Factory bread! <br><br>Drinks came out cold and quick! Beer and mixed drink were both the perfect temperature! Nice and cold. <br><br>I ordered the turkey avocado sandwich! It was so good!!! Bacon was nice, thick and crispy! Turkey was flavorful. Avocado and tomato were fresh and delicious. <br><br>Our server was amazing. Very attentive, and made small talk with us. Kept coming back to our table to make sure we had everything we needed. Such a sweetheart!

This is horrible experience. The one in the Grove is much much better!<br>Don&#39;t go to the Beverly Hills. The service is just like none. <br>The waitress didn&#39;t ask about and check us at all like we didn&#39;t exist. The couple next to us said the same. We all have to raise the hands forever to get a glance. <br>The shrimp with angel hair was served not fully cooked. The noodle was all sticky together like very tough. They recooked for me but still got some tough noodles in it. <br>The shrimp was not too bad. Finally they tried to charge twice for the pasta that they recooked....OMG! She didn&#39;t even apologize for this error, she said our manager were too busy...<br>I&#39;m a fan of Cheesecake factory but I will never ever come back to this place. The service is just a joke.

I would only give 1 star but I feel the waiter did a good job. He was wierd and didn&#39;t make eye contact. I had the chicken and biscuits which is like a pot pie without the pie. It had 2 hairs in it. They said it was corn husk fibers but there is no corn in the chicken and biscuits. I don&#39;t think there any corn with husks on the menu at all. They replaced my dish very quickly almost suspiciously so. <br>In closing I can not recommend this place unless you like your chicken and biscuits with a side of pubes. I hope this review has been helpful.u
So I&#39;m totally recommend this restaurant because food here is really awesome! Cheesecake it&#39;s another part of story! You have to visit The Cheesecake Factory

This place stays open late. If u order to go beware.  Your order is guaranteed to be missing something.  Dining in is just ok.  Guaranteed good service.  They are always out of the artichoke during dinner.   Good selection of food.  The menu is huge

The food here is very unspecial. Came here recently for a friend&#39;s birthday and ordered a cobb salad. Was one of the worst cobbs I&#39;ve had in recent memory - probably cause they used a dressing other than ranch which (imo) goes so perfectly with cobb. Happened to eat a cobb two days earlier from Specialty&#39;s and that salad was far superior in quality of ingredients and it&#39;s not even a dine-in restaurant!<br><br>Their saving grace is the cheesecake of course. I&#39;m not a huge cheesecake fan, but I tried the banana creme and the white chocolate raspberry and both were really delicious.<br><br>Basically, just go here for cheesecake. Eat real food elsewhere.

Very good food and more than anything I loved the location on the roof. I would highly recommend this restaurant because I also enjoyed the area which it is located. Easily can spend the whole day in this area. Service was also phenomenal.
Always sure of quality -- this restaurant was especially nice. Our waiter was attentive but not over-bearing. Great meal!
I absolutely love the avocado egg rolls!

Don&#39;t care what others say -- I like this place.  I especially like it now because you can figure out something vegan to eat.<br><br>I got the Luau Salad.  It was an enormous pile of lettuce, with chopped nuts, shredded carrots, green onions, chopped peppers, beans and bits of other things.  It&#39;s served with chicken so I got that wrapped up and took it home to Joey.  I used a little of their balsamic dressing, which was very nice and not oily.<br><br>Benji had her usual crab cakes, which are always good but a little too breaded, it looks like.  Lee had the weightwatcher salad with chicken, with asparagus and a light dressing.<br><br>Then of course they had to get a piece of chocolate mousse cheesecake to take home.  And did we open it to take a bit?  Yes indeedy.  Oooo.... the absolutely epitome of a smooth, velvety delicious piece of very un-cheesecake-like cheesecake -- it really just tasted like mousse.  Yum.<br><br>Parked next to the Crate and Barrel.

Warning! I was there January 22nd last week for lunch, My 2nd time eating there Don&#39;t go there if you&#39;re wearing a Los Angeles Rams cap as the lunch hostess went out of her way to tell me she didnt like my cap. And after I sat down I heard her still complaining to other employees about the Saints vs Rams championship game.

By far the WORST Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been too. Cheesecake is one of my favorites restaurants. I was looking forward to getting the spicy chicken chipotle pasta.  My friend and I placed our orders. We waited more than 30 minutes for our food. We got there about 9:30pm. There were not many people eating there. So I wasn&#39;t too sure what took so long for our food. The waitress we had, never smiled. We finally got our food, and the pasta sauce was sooo runny. The pasta was swimming in the sauce. It did not taste like the chicken chipotle pasta I&#39;ve had at every other Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been too. The waitress came to check on us once. We were done eating and we literally waited another 30 minutes before we were checked on. She came back and started collecting our dishes, asked if we wanted dessert. We said no that we just wanted a box (for my friends food) and the check. So while we were waiting for the check and take home container, I decided to use the restroom. The restroom is located upstairs. I have no idea what I tripped on, but I trip on something going up the stairs and fell. I got myself up and went upstairs. As I&#39;m coming back down, there were two employees sitting there. They must&#39;ve seen me fall but did not ask me if I was okay or anything. I ignored it and went back to the table. We paid and we left. It was definitely the worst experience ever. The food; the service; everything was terrible.

cheesecake Factory is a casual restaurant .With kind waiters that everything about the food. it has three sections the chairs booths and a mix. my favorite dish is the the impossible burger it is an all plant based burger so it is good for  vegetarian people. the only bad thing is that there is a lot of people so you mite have to wait in a long line but there is a parking lot across the street

This was by far the worst restaurant experience I have ever had in my life. We came with 9 people on a very happy occasion to celebrate a few birthdays. At first they brought only two sets of bread for the whole table, so I asked the waitress for another set of bread and she said yes with a bit of a dirty look. Moving on, they gave my friend a wrong order and didn&#39;t do anything about it. When it came time to paying, all 9 of us wanted to have separate checks that way it would be easier for us to give the waitress a better tip. Turns out she didn&#39;t want to do that and gave us about 4 separate checks because it would &#34;take too long&#34;. Even through all of this we gave a great tip. As we are leaving, another waiter had said to us &#34;Go to McDonalds around the corner&#34;. We were all shocked by this and wanted to get an explanation as to why this uneducated waiter said this to us. When talking to the manager she was very unhelpful and unprofessional. She told us &#34;she does not have to provide us with an explanation or follow up on why the waiter said that to us&#34;. We were not compensated at all and left feeling embarrassed because of how they treated us in front of the public. I cannot wait to call the headquarters tomorrow! DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT I CANNOT EMPHASIZE ENOUGH!!!

All their employees are good humored, they help me a lot. But Jackie who stays at the register never helps. She gave me missing orders so many times. She is also rude to me. Its a perfect place except for Jackie.
Everything was good. But the cheese cake actually was a bit too sweet for Asian people I guess.

To all potential Cheesecake Factory people who want to come here. The water here is so amazing. Like I can&#39;t even with this water. Maybe it is because California is in a drought but this water with the ice is so phenomenal. 5 stars just for the water. I can&#39;t believe it. Our friend said that it tastes like the water from her home refrigerator, which means it is A grade. Dat Kenmore doe. Come for the water, leave with happiness. <br><br>P.S.The potatoes are too crispy but the water makes up for it.

Super super SLOW. EVERYTIME I order to go,it takes AT LEAST 25 mins to get my food. I tried to order to go  a couple days ago and stayed on hold 10 mins before they could find someone to take my order. Finally ordered and she asked if I wanted the lunch or dinner portion of whatever I was ordering. I said well what&#39;s the difference besides portions? She said she didn&#39;t know...go figure. Anyway...I  brought in a family from a CELEBRITY client I have and everyone HATED the food. It was so embarrassing and they asked why I brought them there. Smh. No seasoning on none of the food.

I normally love the Cheesecake Factory and visit the one near my home frequently. However, the Beverly Hills location was a disappointment. The avocado egg rolls were ok, but my fried chicken sandwich was over cooked and as a result the chicken was extremely dry... I didn&#39;t even eat half of it. The worst part was our waiter... he seemed completely uninterested in being there and we had to search for him every time we needed something. It was almost as though he just woke up and was still half asleep. We will not be returning to this location.

Bad: My shrimp garlic noodle was decent. My fiance decided to try to steak. Big mistake! The meat was so tender and soggy that it was inedible. The meat had no flavor. We thought it would taste better the next day. When we open the carton, the meat had already spoiled. <br><br>Good: Our waiter was great. Very attentive. He must have came to our table at least 10 times during dinner

I called the Beverly Hills location to place a simple take out order.  I had to call four times because the three previous times, I was placed on a 15 min hold then hung up on.  I called back the fourth time and asked the hostess if I&#39;d be allowed to place an order this time, or will they be hanging up on me again.  Their excuse is because they were busy so they started to hang up on people.  Great customer service ethic right there.  Make me wait a total of 30 min on the phone only to hang up on me three times with no explanation.  This location should shut down and rethink their work ethics before tarnishing Cheese Factory&#39;s reputation.  Then MAYBE they should reopen.  A 1 star is being generous!

Normally not a big fan of this place but I give credit where credit is due. Today the service was good, and I finally found something on the menu that I like. I suggest that everyone try the shrimp w/ angel hair pasta and make sure to get extra sauce. Combine with the house red wine that I had, I was very satisfied. :-)  As everyone knows you can never go wrong with the cheesecake for dessert.

Whenever I venture across the border, a visit to a Cheesecake Factory is always part of the plan, mainly because we don&#39;t have them in Canada and secondly the food has always been good. You know you&#39;re going to get a great meal, reasonably priced, huge portion size, combined with the largest assortment of cheesecakes on the planet.<br><br>This location bills itself as the original location of a franchise that now has restaurants in most major US cities. It&#39;s location...in Beverly Hills, one block from Rodeo Drive, is ideal. We found parking on the street ($2/hr), but noticed several parking lots in the area with decent rates.<br><br>We were seated immediately (in Buffalo the wait can be upwards of an hour) and then the real challenge begins...what to order from their HUGE menu. We opted for the Orange Chicken (lightly battered white chicken pieces, smothered in an orange sauce, with veggies and brown rice) and  Cashew Chicken (lightly battered chicken pieces in a spicy asian sauce with brown rice)....both were $16.99 each. The portion size is gigantic.....the chicken must have been two full breasts cut into pieces....rich in flavour with a great balance of orange flavour.<br><br>Our server, Lauren R was great. She was attentive, friendly and very efficient. The table next to us were a real pain and she kept her cool through every interaction she had with them. Kudos to her.<br><br>If you&#39;re fortunate enough to have room left over after dinner, a piece of cheesecake is in order. I&#39;ve tried approx. 6 or 7 different kinds, with my favourite being the Key Lime Cheesecake (or what I prefer to call a slice of heaven here on earth). I usually take my dessert to go as I&#39;m always full from dinner.<br><br>I really have only two minor complaints about this location:<br>1) the tables are very close together...so private conversations are not possible (and as a side note to the two dudes seated next to us)..it is a courtesy, when eating out, that you chew your food with your mouth closed, not talk with your mouth full, use utensils, etc, etc.<br>2) my biggest complaint......please open a restaurant in Toronto.....we need a Cheesecake Factory there.<br><br>Great value for great food.

My boyfriend and I were around the area so we decided to eat at Cheesecake Factory on Beverly. It was a Sunday night, 20 minute wait. We were hungry but the wait wasn&#39;t so bad. After being seated, we weren&#39;t approached for about 10 minutes. We ignored it since it seemed busy. As soon as our waiter came in, we ordered all our drinks and food because at that point, we were starving. <br><br>The two glasses of wine came out first and the glass was disgusting. There were what looked like pieces of food from someone else&#39;s mouth that had drank out of the wine glass prior to being given to us... but we ignored it since our waiter was nowhere to be found anyways. Our waiter was nice, but not very attentive. I guess there was really no need since we had everything we needed, but no follow up on how we were doing. Regardless, the service was just okay.<br><br>The reason for the three stars is because it&#39;s Beverly Hills... I don&#39;t care if it is a freakin&#39; Islands, this place should be an upgrade from any other of its franchises given its location alone. Maybe don&#39;t dim the lights as much so you can see what is dirty and what isn&#39;t? Also, my seat had the view of the servers drink station and it was very unappealing watching servers comb through their hair with their hands and then touch the tip of the straw where customers put their mouths. Just saying.<br><br>Most likely will not be back to this location.
It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. Why are you yelping Cheesecake Factory? You come here when you want to hate yourself and eat portions that make any American proud.<br><br>10/10 would hate myself here

DO NOT COME HERE!!!!!! READ BEFORE EATING HERE!! WORST EXPERIENCE AT A RESTAURANT EVER!!! Imagine having a wonderful day and you make plans to go to good old Cheesecake Factory. You&#39;re enjoying the great sweet bread when all of a sudden the busser slams a plate of butter onto your table. It&#39;s okay, I was being patient and understood the guy probably hated being there for some reason. So when I turned over to him and asked for new butter since he threw it onto my gf and it got all over her clothes, I simply asked if we could have another plate of butter since he threw the last one. Honestly I should&#39;ve flipped on the guy, but I thought maybe he didn&#39;t realize what he just did. I was WRONG. The guy was probably the most rude staff member I have ever experienced at a restaurant. The fact that he holds a job in an industry meant to serve people is mind blowing. When I asked for the butter replacement he yelled, &#34;go ask your waitress!&#34; And I replied, &#34;excuse me? Did you not just see how you threw that butter and dropped it on my gf?&#34; And he yelled again, &#34;well go ask your waitress!&#34; I think the people around us were shocked at how crazed this guy was. My blood was boiling and did everything to not smack some sense into his foolish behavior. So I requested to speak to the manager and he had a fat smile on his face saying, &#34;okay let&#39;s go talk to the manager.&#34; As soon as I approached the manager I explained how cruel and unacceptable this behavior was while the guy was standing next to the manager bickering about how the waitress should be taking care of us and not him, and the manager was even trying to shut him up but he wouldn&#39;t stop talking. The managers response to me was, &#34;I&#39;ll talk to him.&#34; Wow... they seemed pretty buddy buddy so I know he didn&#39;t say anything. If I were the manager I would&#39;ve told the guy to go home (cause he clearly didn&#39;t want to be there that day) and let us eat in peace. Instead, we left because we were uncomfortable that this guy was still going to be there after he was being aggressive and cruel towards us. I will NEVER STEP FOOT IN THIS LOCATION AGAIN. And if this company really cared about business and it&#39;s customers, that manager should be replaced or trained, and the bussser should&#39;ve been fired. I wish someone would&#39;ve recorded the whole experience, guarantee the video would&#39;ve went viral and Cheesecake Factory would&#39;ve made national news.

I&#39;ve been here quite a few times but I must really say that this time I was impressed with the service. It had been a while since I&#39;d gone into the Cheesecake Factory so the mrs suggested we try it again. It was a little past two and there seem to be a line.
