However, as we approached the hostess she asked us if we were with the much larger group, she peeked into one if the rooms and went on to show us to our table. <br>Shortly thereafter we were greeted by Chris who provided us with the daily special. He asked us for drinks and was very prompt on bringing it to us. He even have us two orders of bread without asking After we received our order which I must say took a while we checked on from time to time. A definite overall good experience. Thank u Chris.
The first to try this. We have ordered the orange chicken and Chocolate chip cheesecake. The orange is fine and the cake is tasty.

What happened to this location??? I remember enjoying it about 5 years ago, but after dish after dish of disappointment and bad service (and possibly bad luck), I&#39;ve decided to write a review for this Cheesecake Factory location. <br><br>I used to looooooove cheesecake factory. The environment looked very nice, and they have great variety, as well as amazing cheesecakes. Service used to be better, but my recent experiences were just the opposite. <br><br>This is from my most recent experience:<br><br>We got in and waited, but no one was there to greet and seat us. Once someone came by, we got seated quickly, which was good. The waitress said that she can take our baby&#39;s stroller away and bring us a high chair. The bf collapsed the stroller to save room, but it took nearly ten minutes for the high chair to come. <br><br>Our orders were taken, and she said that she will bring us our bread and butter. That never showed up. Other tables got bread and butter, but we did not. We also were not offered refills of water. <br><br>It took a long time for our appetizer to come out. We got the buffalo wings that day because I wanted something spicy, and we can feed chicken to our little one. Once we were done with the wings, we waited nearly half an hour for our entrees to show up. Ahhh.. that means we had to pay for parking in that 2 hour free lot, since we waited so much already! <br><br>Anyways, the buffalo wings were just decent. Not worth the money. The sauce tasted great, but the meat itself was just super dry. I&#39;ve had better from Domino&#39;s. Quite depressing, huh? <br><br>So our entrees finally came. We ordered the grilled chicken kids meal for the little one, the burrito for the bf, and the chinese chicken salad for myself. The kids meal was a total rip off. Our little one refused to eat any of it! She normally loves chicken, but she kept spitting it out. UGH!! Oh, it was just super dry. Gross. <br>My salad looked smaller than the other times I&#39;ve ordered it. Maybe I should have stuck with a sandwich or a burger. The salad was drenched and all disgusting, as if it was just sitting out there for at least half an hour. There was only a few small pieces of chicken inside. TOTAL RIPOFF! It used to be great, but that salad to price ratio was the worst ever. Other chains, such as cpk, now offers better chinese chicken salads. Sorry, cheesecake factory... what happened to yours?? I would have ordered the tuna tataki salad, but I&#39;m pregnant again, soooo that was out of the question for uber safety issues. <br>At least the bf&#39;s burrito was decent. The presentation was one long burrito on an oval plate with sauce and tomatoes on top of it. It was the most worthwhile thing we got that day. It came with a side of guacamole, sour cream, and black beans. <br><br>Sooooo.... overall, Cheesecake Factory has declined a lot. Portions used to be bigger, service used to be better, and I&#39;ve always got my free bread and butter, but that experience... nope. Horrible. Just horrible. I was lucky that I paid mostly in giftcards because if I were to use my own hard earned cash at this place, I&#39;d be super pissed. Sad that the San Vincente location in west LA closed.. *SIGH* <br><br>In the past, I&#39;ve tried the following: <br>tons of fun burger (decent), chicken enchiladas (yum), veggie burger (decent), mushroom burger (way too greasy), chicken teriyaki (too many fat chunks), chicken picatta (second grossest thing I&#39;ve had here), pulled pork sandwich (lacking the meats quite a bit), fish tacos (okay), tuna takaki salad (probably my favorite entree, but such a small portion), the navajo (good sandwich), chicken sandwich (okay), fish and chips (use extra sauce and ketchup in case of dryness), lettuce wraps (used to be better as well), chicken pot stickers (so small!), avocado eggrolls (meh), and more. <br>I&#39;ve also tried most their cheesecake menu, and those at least were always par or better. My faves are the vanilla bean, dulce de leche, and tiramisu. I will be trying their mango keylime tonight, since I got it to go.<br><br>When I&#39;m not pregnant anymore, I&#39;ll probably just return for drinks (MOJITO!!!!) and cheesecake.

Absolutely horrible.  We ordered this on Postmates and the food arrived dried out and cold.  Tasted like it had sat under a heat lamp for 3 hours then was removed and got cold and stale.  Not only that, but the cheesecake had what I believe is a piece of parchment paper baked between the layers.  Imagine biting into cheesecake and getting a mouth full of nasty paper.  I will never eat there again.  Absolutely horrible.
Excellent food- stuffed mushroom and pastas, good ambiance. Huge fan of the Red velvet cheesecake ..
Bad service &amp; the food wasn&#39;t as good as other cheesecake factories, don&#39;t recommend coming here

Came here on a Sunday night and it was an amazing time. The waitress, Nicole, was very nice and friendly. She got to me in a timely manner for everything from the greeting all the way to when I was finished. The food of course was a amazing as well. Fresh, well cooked and delicious. For a Sunday night, there was a good amount of traffic so the environment was very upbeat and fun. Highly recommend this place!!

For Cheesecake factory, it&#39;s sometimes a hit and miss, depending who&#39;s your chef and who serves you? <br><br>Surprisingly they don&#39;t do better to satisfy their customers because I was a mystery shopper for their corporate numerous of times. Corporate FREQUENTLY give out Mystery jobs out at all their locations. <br><br>When I go to Cheesecake Factory, I always ordered the Thai Pasta. And its always a hit and missed item depending on the chef! <br>I like it the way it&#39;s supposed to be. Noodles chewy not soggy and sauces stick on the noodles not runny that makes the tastes like watered down peanut butter soup. (sorry yes that&#39;s how it tastes like, if they don&#39;t cook it right.) <br><br>Unfortunately that day at this location, it was pretty soggy.. :-( <br>The waiter, Ashley asked if I wanted to change my entree... I agreed and decided to go with the Bistro shrimp pasta which was delicious!! <br><br>Our waiter was so polite and well mannered. Through our entire visit he was smiling, always checking with us if we were alright.... Until shift change! We were introduce by a waitress named Kelly. She was NOT polite. We asked her for an extra plate to share our cheesecake, she almost seemed she was rushed with anger to serve us. Almost throwing the plate on our table. Not a smile, never came to refill our drinks, and we had to searched all over for her to get a check and another minutes to get a to go box. <br><br>** NOTE ABOUT TIPPING WHEN YOU are in A MIDDLE OF A SHIFT CHANGE**** <br>As we left, we walked to the front of the counter, I politely asked if I can speak to the manager about seeing how do they split the tips in regarding shift changes. I had already left a 15% tip, just in case our first waiter was getting some of the tips. The manager confirmed to me that the tips went to the server that picks up the shift. .. FYI! <br><br>Wanted to take back every penny of my tip, but didn&#39;t! grrrrrr.

Very disappointed with My order today, after waiting 20 minutes for my plate the manager came to me and said part of order won&#39;t be ready for another hour, so I changed my meal, after waiting another 20 minutes, (at this point i had to ask my server to pack it to go bc i need to get back to work) as I&#39;m getting ready to eat my meal at my desk,  I notice the lettuce for my Thai lettuce cups are dirty!! Sooo disappointing!

Oreo cheesecake is awesome! Even looking at it makes my mouth watery... In a good drooling kind of way. Their bacon bacon cheeseburger is so good and juicy; I&#39;m a self confessed bacon lover. Spaghetti carbonara was okay; a bit bland so wouldn&#39;t recommend it. Tropical ice tea was thirst quenching!
Is it legal to serve alcohol with children when they are sitting at a bar the Bartender is serving  alcohol check out the pic&#39;s

I would expect this with any Resturant except Cheesecake Factory when we ordered lunch to office I got &#34;Luisiana chicken&#34; I was shocked and disgust me all the day long as a pregnant when I saw a BUNCH of Hair not ONE in my plate!

Such amazing food Cheesecake Factory has but wow does it give you bathroom issues ! Eating at Cheesecake Factory will throw you on the toilet for hours and hours if not days ! My parents can&#39;t stand the smell of the toilet from all the food I ate here ! If you want your toilet to smell up an entire block come here !

I like cheesecake for the huge variety in their menu. I also like that their portions are huge so you can easily share an entree and order a small salad and have a reasonable priced menu. Not to mention that you will most likely still have leftovers. So there&#39;s definitely value in eating at these restaurant chains. <br><br>Located in the heart of Beverly Hills, my husband and I walked here so we didn&#39;t have to worry about parking. They have metered street parking that&#39;s usually super packed on weekend evenings. They also have plentiful parking garages that offers free two hour parking before 5 or all day $5 parking. <br><br>Service is really good. I usually order the jambalaya pasta that&#39;s always consistently good. Not your typical jambalaya plate with rice and gumbo. It&#39;s mostly a cajuny pasta dish that&#39;s jammed packed with flavor. <br><br>I also ordered the chicken tostada salad. It&#39;s HUGE! The salad was the size of two human heads on the plate. Very delicious also.

The absolute worse service I&#39;ve ever experienced! If you are a person of color (African American) and want to be treated equal as those around you DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE! I literally watched as 3 table came and left while we sat there and didn&#39;t get any type of acknowledgement! Discrimination to the fullest!

I had no idea that this was the very first Cheesecake Factory location! Who woulda thought it started here in LA...<br><br>If you&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory, you already know what you&#39;re getting--they&#39;re SUPER consistent, from my experience. If you haven&#39;t already been to a CF before, prepare for a HUGE menu, very very big portions, and helpful, friendly service.<br><br>We came on a Thursday evening (a little on the late side) and got seated INSTANTLY. This has never happened in my CF experience... ever! Service was very, very attentive and they had some kind of secret system set up where 3-4 different people helped us through the night in tandem... interesting, no? It also felt a little smaller than I&#39;ve experienced before, but we only saw the very front area (where we were seated).<br><br>We had our usuals -- avocado egg rolls, kale salad, and the husband&#39;s Chicken Bellagio... with lots of brown bread :) Everything was solid, as expected.<br><br>PARKING was okay actually--the meters end at 8 (or 9pm...) and we found a spot right across the street, though that&#39;s probably not the case during a normal time of day. They do have valet, so I guess they&#39;re on par with the Marina Del Rey location in that sense. Boo for no better parking alternatives.

Like this place. The hostess is sassy and nice and the servers also. The food is good too but the calamari we ordered was not cooked all the way. The batter was still flaky and white. It was all bunched up and the inside was not fully cooked. Other than that rest of the food was good!

This is by far the WORSE Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to and it sucks, because it&#39;s one of my favorite American Restaurants for: complimentary freshly baked bread, a wide selection of food, good service and lively ambiance.  Why was it so bad?<br><br>1.You must pay for parking to eat there.<br>2.It is too small and crowded. No waiting place.<br>3.The bathroom is upstairs &amp; a safety hazard. <br>4. Imagine tripping down the steep flight of stairs!!!!<br>5.The bathroom flooring is uneven &amp; dangerous.<br>6. A swinging door can injure someone.<br>7. My server Lauren was rude and inattentive towards me.<br>8. Never got the paper napkins &amp; cheese I asked for.<br>9. I wanted to order 2 more things, but was ignored.<br>10. I switched to Nicole instead.<br>11. She&#39;s a much better &amp; diligent worker.<br>12. Nicole was much friendlier, too... :)<br>13. Nicole gives accurate &amp; fast service... :)<br><br>Ordered 3 things from the &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; Menu:<br><br>1. Greek salad: 4 stars<br>2. Edamame: 3 stars<br>3. Chicken &amp; Mushroom Wraps: 3.5 stars

This place is not clean. They set the table with dirty utensils. The server look like he hated his job. The bread was hard and the service was crappy. This is the worst cheesecake I have ever been too! Do your self a favor and don&#39;t come. They need to get a hold of this place.

They basically will be downgraded to 4 stars because every time  I have been there I almost fell, I&#39;m assuming that it&#39;s because their kitchen is open to the walk way, their floors are always SUPER slippery, they all wear tennis shoes and maybe don&#39;t realize it, but I guess until someone falls and seriously hurts themselves, that&#39;s when they will actually do something about it

Reduced menu from regular Cheesecake Factories.  Last time we were there, service was poor; I do think part of this might be the tight design of the space.  It&#39;s the same food as other CFs but I wouldn&#39;t go if you need attention at your table.

If I could give negative stars I would. We bought my friend here for her birthday and maybe were a little spoiled because our Sherman oaks location gives us sliced strawberries cut bread for our 1 year old within 15 mins of being there. This location acted like it was a big deal and charged us for it. Our pasta was al dente and when the server asked how it was I said to hard and not good for the baby she didn&#39;t even offer to re cook it. They took Forever for our 3 entrees and I kept asking when not just because we had a baby bit because it was way over normal wait time.  The manager was sooo rude a lady who didn&#39;t seem to care either. Horrible location great view of the promenade you can go somewhere else for that.

So I was in the area and decided to bring my mom to lunch here. <br><br>She loved the chicken club sandwich and her fries. <br><br>I tried the Chicken Madeira. It was delicious. Cooked to perfection and worth all the calories.  The servings are so big that i only had room for half my plate. I took the rest home. <br><br>We also shared a dulce de leche cheesecake which was amazing.

Great food. Good service. Appealing atmosphere. Prices within reason. I love the Luau Salad and the Dynamite Chicken. Highly consistent quality across locations. <br><br>Good to Know:<br>This location had valet parking for $7 and a dog friendly patio in front.<br><br>Memory Lane:<br>This is the original Cheesecake Factory location and my parents used to drive us out to BH for the treat of eating here. Love the cheesecake - original style!

I love this place! The portions are hugh! I really love the deserts! Just go there!<br><br>I always get the Spicey cashew chicken<br><br>Also adams peanut butter cheesecake are tje best<br><br>The avacafo eggrolls are to die for!

Got seated right away. Excellent service by Kyle. He was attentive and got everything right the first time. The food was good for the most part. They did somehow royally mess up on one of the two burgers we ordered. Kyle and the manager rectified the problem right away. <br><br>I bumped them down to 3 stars because the gentleman that brought the burgers didn&#39;t ask who ordered medium and who ordered the well done. The result was someone had half a burger and someone had a burger and a half.

Have been longing for this cheesecake for a long time.<br>One piece is really big, $6.95. <br>They have so many types, and I cannot make a decision. <br>The waiter recommended the red velvet and the chocolate fudge. I think I prefer the original taste of cheese cake. It is thick. <br>But actually, I&#39;m not a big fan of cheesecake. I can never finish one piece by myself. And I think they just look pretty.

Cheese Cake Factory... One of the popular American(?) fusion restaurants in SoCal. You probably have visited this franchise restaurant at least once in your life I believe.<br>The Beverly Hills location is not a far different than other locations.<br>Modern design interior with dark atmosphere.<br>Romantic and casual place to hang and enjoy your meals.<br>Most food entries are decent and prices are reasonable as well.<br>I gave 4 stars because its noisiness and loudness of the interior space.<br>Sometimes so loud that you cannot hear your companies unless you sit right next to them.<br>But with decent crowd, it is a perfect place.

So, I use my lunch break to walk to this location and order Tex Mex Egg Rolls. I get back to my office and it&#39;s Avocado Egg Rolls. I call them and my only options are to come back now, after work or refund. I took the refund because I am at work so I obviously can&#39;t come back now and I don&#39;t want that for dinner. I want the lunch that I ordered and was prepared to eat. You would think that there would have been more empathy on their end but nope. Just a simple &#34;we will make sure they go over the order with the customer next time&#34;. I feel slighted and I&#39;m pissed because there goes my lunch break. No resolution and nothing to eat. I think it&#39;s unacceptable. She should have made him bring my food since my office is in walking distance. As a customer I didn&#39;t leave that situation satisfied. It&#39;s not about the money. It is really about the food.

My server Vito gave us the most amazing customer service!<br><br>I love the cheesecake Factory and I&#39;ve gone to all the ones in LA, The thing that stood out in the one in Beverly Hills was my server Vito&#39;s customer service. My girl and I enjoyed our food as usual but our server was extremely nice and anticipated everything we wanted. His attention to detail and pleasant demeanor made our dinning experience a memorable one. I think this will be our go to spot for the Cheesecake Factory. I would totally recommend this place and I hope Vito is your server when you go cause having a server anticipate before you ask is the best!

Food was just like any other Cheesecake Factory. We went during lunch time and were seated immediately. Our drink order was quickly placed, so we were glad about that, especially since we did a lot of walking. Now, here is where it gets a little tough, we had to request bread a few times before the waiter brought it out, and the waiter  seemed a bit preoccupied or something. It didn&#39;t really bother us at the time, however in completing my review, I like to be honest and that could be the drawback to why I did not give 5 stars. We also had to request our check a couple of times, and this is huge when you paid for metered parking and the time is close to end, and you are parked far. Food wise, we always enjoy the Cheesecake Factory food, so no complaints there.<br><br>The location is good. I wish they had more patio seating in the front, its designed not for a family or group, but for 2 people or 3 not as endowed people. Oh well, just a thought.  Honestly, if service was just a bit better, it would have been 5 stars. We still had an overall good experience!

They weren&#39;t kidding when they said this was the worst. <br>Waiter was impatient taking orders and left the table<br>Waiter didn&#39;t write down my request for added sun dried tomatoes<br>My Alfredo pasta was stuck together<br>In laws pasta was al dente <br>The kid&#39;s burger was requested well done yet it was somehow half rare and half medium (wtf). The waiter Kurt saw the bright red meat but didn&#39;t take the time to address it.<br>The waiter also bumped me at least three times and didn&#39;t say a thing.<br>Upon leaving the bus boy opened the door for me yet let it close in my in laws face.<br><br>I also don&#39;t think they like middle eastern people there. When we came in a middle eastern table was waiting and waiting for their change. They just ended up leaving after maybe twenty minutes. The smaller couple of two that sat next to us was also treated poorly. The man apparently tried to use a translator with the waiter and was told he was going to have to speak.<br><br>The place is also cramped and the main restrooms are upstairs.

The sign of GREAT service is highlighted when a manager on duty recognizes a mess up and fixes it with graciousness and professionalism.<br>We arrived for a b-day celebration with a prearranged reservation for a party of 8.<br>Host declares that he does not see a reservation on his screen but he would try to get us a table when one becomes available.<br>Not satisfies with his run of the mill generic answer we ask for a manager. <br>Blake arrived with a positive and caring can-do attitude. Had us seated within 15 minutes with a some on-the house appies quickly delivered. <br>Class act.<br>Food is the standard fair at CCF. Fresh, huge portions that are pretty good.<br>5 stars mainly for the great service and attitude.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my all time favorite chain restaurants. Good prices a wide range of dishes and excellent portions. And not to mention GREAT butter and sweet bread!. I like the Beverly Hills location; great atmosphere. My go dishes are the Pasta da Vinci, Cajun Jimbalaya and the Bistro shrimp pasta. Favorite desserts are the Tiramisu cheesecake and the Godiva cheesecake! These never fail me! :-)
Dinner was solid, a little longer than average wait time but still good.
This place never disappoints. Good looking waiters, extensive menu, and amazing red velvet cheesecake! My usual order is either the chicken marsala or the spicy chicken chipotle pasta

I love this location. Only thing that sucks is the parking, but hey its Beverly Hills, right? Last time i ate here was to have a little celebration with a good friend. The host said we would have to wait about 20 minutes but ten minutes later our table was ready! I had the fried shrimp platter and chicken pasta. The shrimp was delicious and not too greasy. The pasta was yummy, a touch of lemon, not too salty. The only thing that keeps me from giving it a full five stars is the service. Our waiter took a while to get to our table and then he kept disappearing whenever we needed him. Good thing another guy kept checking on us and even offered me cheese without me asking.<br><br>Yes ill be back.

Came here after a wedding. Delicious!! And we tried the new coconut vhicken. Yum! Our waiter Kevin was very friendly and very gregarious. I will be back!! The drinks were nice and strong too. Yum!!!!!
Very great food.  Waiters were very polite and on top of things. The cheesecake is to die for.  Also very clean environment.

This Cheesecake Factory holds a place near and dear to my heart.<br>I remember meeting up with family here over 10 years ago and back again last week was a real flashback.<br>Just as I remembered, given the location, a ton of Hollywood wannabees, many &#34;important&#34; phone calls, overdressed for where they are and a ton of tourists visiting Beverly Hills wanting to have a cheap and filling meal.<br>The waits like at any Cheesecake Factory are long.<br>The menu even longer.<br>Seriously, the selection is just too  big.<br>Somehow they manage to make most dishes really taste ok.<br>You can eat anything from American to Mexican cuisine here, really anything you could be in the mood for, I am sure they will have.<br>I usually go with one of the huge salads, good but enough sodium and fat for the entire day.<br>Their happy hour at the bar is pretty good, i liked most of the food, the portions aren&#39;t as insane and with $5 a plate you can&#39;t really go wrong.<br>Service is always rushed and way too busy but the orders come out at a descent time.<br>On my dime or if dinner is my choice, I would never come here, but for a chain it is A-Ok compared to most others.

1. Just saw the manager take food out of a to go box and put them on a plate with his bare hands. To the manager: we can see you.<br><br>2. They ran out of lemon herb chicken and didn&#39;t tell me until my wife&#39;s food came out.<br><br>The manager did take care of the bill so I can get pass #2. Definitely cannot get pass number 1. My waiter was a really cool guy though so 2 stars instead of 1.

Since the time I walked into Cheesecake Factory in Beverly Hills service was amazing!  I sat at the bar, still on the phone my server Kevin M gave me the respect to wait to ask me what I&#39;d like to drink until I was finished. I got the buffalo blasts! They were amazing as well! I had a request for a personal pasta which normally people don&#39;t do so I was very impressed with this level of service. I have always liked the Cheesecake Factory but now I LOVE it and will be back!

This is specifically for our server Nicole. She&#39;s been there for almost 9 years (I think that&#39;s what she said). She is a very good server. Friendly, professional, and has a good sense of humor. We all felt she was the best server we have encountered. Keep up the good work. People like Nicole make going out to dinner enjoyable. Thanks!

PLEASE READ<br>Oh my God I cannot believe the service that I received here the other day! This is a location that I normally visit but the waitress was so unpleasant this day. We ordered stuff mushrooms and they were horrible, the waitress did not apologize nor did a manager ever come over to say anything about the mushrooms that were so unpleasant.<br>My colleague and I ordered shrimp scampi to go. However when I got home and ate my shrimp scampi..the shrimp a bit rancid. I stop eating the shrimp and proceeded to call a manager (Blake) at that location, letting him know that our service was not that pleasant from the waitress (Kelly), And &#34;the shrimp scampi that I ordered to go... the shrimp were a bit rancid, or maybe not being that fresh&#34;.<br>He asked me &#34;how did you pay for the meal&#34;! I calmly let him know &#34;I was on lunch and one of my colleagues treated&#34;. <br>He said that he would inform his kitchen and talk to the waiter. He never apologize for the horrible customer service, or for the fact of the scampi being unpleasant to my palate. He asked me &#34;can I help you with anything else&#34;. I said yes &#34;I&#39;d appreciate a compensation, or I can bring the meal back if you want&#34; he later told me &#34;you did not pay for the meal I don&#39;t see what&#39;s the problem&#34;! <br>I sat on the phone with my mouth wide-open for seconds.... I COOULD NOT BELIEVE THAT HE WAS SPEAKING THAT WAY TO A CUSTOMER!!!!!! <br>I called the next day to speak to another manager which was quite more pleasant, and very forgiving for my horrible service. He was so taken back and offered to send a gift card out for his apologies. <br>THANKS RICARDO <br>DR. S. WALKER M.D<br>I gave two stars because I appreciate the managers efforts to send out the gift-card. <br>The drink was great, my Greek salad was great, and the chicken samosas were good as well.

TERRIBLE SERVICE! When I go to a chain restaurant with mediocre food, then service is EVERYTHING, and this place has servers who don&#39;t really know what their job is. Several times we had to call over our waitress to take our order or get us a drink! And she barely cracked a smile. I wanted to treat my uncle and aunt, who were visiting from out of the country, to a typical American chain, and I was soooo ashamed at the kind of treatment we got. <br><br>If you must go to Cheesecake Factory, don&#39;t go to this one.

Terrible service and pathetic attitude of this jackass waiter made me put an effort to sign up on yelp and write a negative review.. So Ive been going to this place for years and never had a bad experience except last night when i was trying to explain how i want my shrimp done this stupid waiter gave me the worst attitude which made me almost leave. I even discussed the situation with manager but it seemed like she did not really care except she only asked if i wanted another waiter and off course i said yes. Anyways i had the worst worst experience ever and was extremely disappointed.
Generally their food is good and I often get my lunch there; however, I cannot recommend the Fish &amp; Chips. Whole lot of batter and barely any fish. Disappointing.

I have eaten at the Cheesecake Factory before and it has been very good. This location served me a steak that was like shoe leather. My French fries were cold and our server was MIA. Worst meal and service I ever had. <br><br>Find somewhere else to eat.
Love this place! Seems like get in every time quick and service is great! Must haves are the Mac and Cheese balls, Mexican salad, red velvet cheese cake... amazing menu!!!

This is such a great Cheesecake Factory. The staff are amazing and made sure all of our needs were taken care of from appetizer to dessert. I would recommend to anyone who wants a cost effective meal that tastes amazing.

Best place to eat in Beverly Hills. It does not have valet or even parking but, there is 3 hours free city parking across the street.  Cheaper than a trip to The Santee Alley in down town LA if you ask me.

I&#39;ve never thought of Cheesecake Factory as a &#34;great&#34; place to begin with, but at least each location is consistently mediocre and reliable - except this one. <br><br>We came here because were beyond starving after spending what felt like 5 hours at Z Gallerie a few doors down. There was no wait, and we were seated at a table awkwardly placed in the middle of the tiny front room. Our server, Andrew, who was sweating profusely, greeted us pretty quickly and we ordered an iced tea and a chocolate milkshake while we decided what to eat. <br><br>He came back with one water, and explained that the milkshake would be a few minutes since they were making it from scratch - whatever that means. Not a problem, until he came back 5 minutes later with no iced tea in hand and told us again that the milkshake was being made from scratch. When he brought the milkshake out, he apologized that it took so long due to the whole made by scratch getup. We didn&#39;t even mind the wait until he kept bringing it up with his weird excuse. We ordered at that point, and received our food a quick 10 minutes later. <br><br>Andrew and his runner practically threw our plates onto the table which alarmed us and the other 6 people sitting on top of us before they quickly ran out of the room. The boyfriend&#39;s chicken was fine, but my salad was completely soggy. Considering they didn&#39;t even ask if everything looked ok, I decided sending it back would be a waste of my time.  Throughout the meal, our server kept grabbing small plates, ramekins and silverware off the table which was so unnecessary and rude considering they weren&#39;t very busy, which also made me wonder why he was sweating so much...<br><br>Nothing could have saved this overpriced experience, as the service, food and atmosphere all seemed doomed from the moment we walked through the door.

Recently Cheesecake Factory got off Postmates and is only available on Doordash for deliveries. Let me start by saying I live 4 min from the restaurant... and because I&#39;m a mom it&#39;s way more convenient for me to have food delivered. I&#39;ve had numerous issues w/ Doordash. My 1st experience took 2 hours for 2 slices of premade cheesecake. My 2nd experience moments ago I waited an hour before having to call Doordash to realize the dasher had declined the order and now have to wait another 50 min. Doordash has terrible customer service offering $5 credit for an order that stated would be delivered 23 min not 2 hours. I tried calling Cheesecake to speak to a manager about their delivery partner and their host was rude. Jessica I believe her name was... placed me on a 10 min hold. When I hung up and called back she said well they&#39;re busy... smh. 1. Cheesecake Factory needs to reevaluate who they partner with for deliveries. The delay changes the quality of the food when it&#39;s sat for over an hour. 2. A manager shouldn&#39;t take 10 min to speak to a customer. I love Cheesecake Factory but I am so furious at this level of service.
The menu is extensive. Food and service is friendly. Only drawback is the crowds and parking. But every place in Beverly Hills has that problem.

So for this restaurant to be in Beverly Hills is a very sad restaurant. I&#39;m talking about the food being horrible, service and just the restaurant, the layout and how old and dirty it is. The chairs and tables are very old and out of place. It&#39;s like there is no unity and comfort ness at this place. The food is also not as good as other cheesecake factories. In my Asian salad there was slot of ingredients missing which was weird. I tried to use the bathroom down stairs but it was so dirty and smelly that I couldn&#39;t even use it. The bathroom upstair is also dirty and smelly and just the steps getting there have the oldest and dirtiest carpet you have ever seen that even smells bad. The service was horrible and they kept dropping things and break g things and of course as we were eating coming around to mop the place with a very dirty mop. Come on I know you are busy and have consumers but you&#39;re in Beverly Hills so remodel the place and have better service for all the people specially tourists trying to eat there. I would say this is one of the worst Cheesecake favorites in Los Angeles!

The service was the problem but read on: The food was good. I got the truffle bacon grilled cheese and the chicken taquitos. The bacon was crisp and the truffle oil was definitely present. Yum! The taquitos were crispy and the meat was tender. The worst part of our experience was the service. Ronnie was our waiter at first. He was really nice. Then he left because he was at the end of his shift and turned us over to Brandon G. Our bill came to $51.36. We paid $60 in cash and Brandon brought back $8.50 in cash. When my friend said where&#39;s the rest of the change Brandon didn&#39;t get it. Even when we explained the numbers didn&#39;t add up all he got was agitated. He took 2 quarters from his own pocket and slammed them down on the table! He said here ya go and walked off! How disrespectful, inappropriate and unprofessional! My friends and I will never visit this location again. Just because it&#39;s Beverly Hills doesn&#39;t mean you can be rude to your customers!

It&#39;s obvious this place is for tourists- evidently they are used to poor service and bad food ! A manager delivered my entree - first off the biscuits were obviously BURNT BLACK - and she still set it down in front of me- my reaction prompted her then to get fresh biscuits - I tried to give the dish a try regardless of the beginning - FIRST BITE OF CHICKEN SO OVERCOOKED IT CRUNCHED IN MY MOUTH!  This restaurant is obviously the root of bad food spread across our country!  Throw in the towel Chessecake Factory - you&#39;ve ran your course !

I got the Mac and cheese burger and it was fantastic. Everyone got their food in a timely manner and the proportions were solid. The burger was delicious, well seasoned and cooked to order. It did feel like it needed a little something extra on it, but I couldn&#39;t quite put my finger on it. The only bad part of this Cheesecake Factory is the men&#39;s bathroom was tiny. It felt like an airplane bathroom and the floor felt slippery.
Daisy at the front is awesome, she&#39;s very nice and all I ever do is See her work, GIVE HER A RAISE!!

First time dining-in and we sat in the patio area. The table appeared as though it was not cleaned thoroughly. The appetizer plates were dirty and one of the plates had a piece of lettuce leaf on the outer rim. When the water cups arrived there were white particles floating around. Needless to say, we asked the waitress for replacements. The second round of water arrived only to experience the same issue, unknown substance in the water. This time there was a large piece of what appears to be a napkin floating in one of the cups. We finally asked for a manager to address the issue about the cleanliness of their water. He apologized, brought us new cups of water but again the same issue.<br><br>Our meal was fine but it could of had a more pleasant beginning.

Good food, good ambience, and good service by our waiter. I usually eat at the San Diego Fashion Valley location which is really big and busy. I appreciated the smaller cozier vibe at the Beverly Hills location plus you get to see exotic cars driving by as if spending half a million on a car is normal. We had macaroni and cheese fries balls and they were Delish. We also had the avocado egg rolls which is one of our favorites at the cheesecake factory. We took an Original Cheescake slice to go back to the hotel and I am so glad we went with the original cheesecake slice instead of their other 50 options. The Original Cheesecake is the BEST...

Great locations and decor and friendly enough staff, but for me the service was too rushed - meals were brought over while some on our table were still working their way through the starters - and the meals themselves were just far too large. The sliders I had for my starter were four almost standard size burgers. Then the main meal came and I barely made a dent in it. <br><br>Perhaps wouldn&#39;t be too bad if you knew in advance they were that large and then you just bought one to share between two, but that feels a bit pointless. Also, the menu was huge. Possibly the largest I&#39;ve ever seen. So large that it stopped for an ad break from time to time. Point for awesome looking desserts (that I never got to trying as the starter had filled me up already) and another point for amazing value. But cheap meals and oversized portions aren&#39;t for me. Could have charged the same price for meals half the size, and shortened the menu by a good 5 pages, and it would be fantastic.

Very pleased with the service here! Amazing service plus excellent food served very quickly! I recommend ordering the edamame  and garlic bread. The caesar salad is also yummy! <br>Love having the option to sit indoors or outside to people watch. Great location with easy parking. Will be back again when traveling in beverly hills!

We went to Cheesecake Factory Beverly Hills with a fair degree of anticipation, the first night we were told a 40 minute wait, have a couple of drinks in the bar, yeah right, if I&#39;m hungry I want my dinner, now.<br>We went elsewhere that night, but returned the next night. <br>The service was rushed and in-attentive, the entree of crumbed Calamari was definitely the worst I have EVER had, dry, stringy, floury, a major disappointment. <br>The main of herb salmon was OK, too much mashed potato, however I gave it my best effort.<br>The reason to go there was desserts, but after a terrible entree, and an average but too large main, it was all over for me, get me out of this place !!
Had a horrible experience don&#39;t recommend this location. Was treated like I was not a paying customer. Most likely never gonna come back

Never, ever would I choose a restaurant like this.<br><br>HUGE, overflowing portions of food.  Contributing to the obesity problem we have in america.<br><br>Middle class eats.<br><br>Do I need to say anything more?

I have a severe dairy allergy and I made sure I asked to not include cheese on my burger. Waited 20 mins to get food and it came with cheese and it took almost half an hour to get it replaced and it came as the wrong sandwich... again.  The service was slow and the kitchen needs to pay more attention to allergies.

I do pickup orders for lunch for my company at least once a month. I really like the different kinds of items the menu offers. There are literally a trillion things on this menu! I don&#39;t know how the chefs do it! I have worked in Beverly Hills for about 6 years and I always try something different every time. But one thing that always strikes me is their cheesecake. I love their cheesecake, hence their name. They have so much variety and you seriously can&#39;t go wrong with choosing any of them from the menu, unless you don&#39;t like cheesecake! <br><br>The employees at the pickup area are always extra nice. The orders are always ready in a timely matter. The orders are easy to place over the phone, I just wished they open a little earlier given that someone of us at our company take early lunches.<br><br>One thing I really dislike about the place is the parking, there are only 1-2 parking spaces that indicate &#34;Pick-up Only&#34; and they&#39;re always filled! Then I would have to find metered parking and pay for about 10 minutes. One star is dinged for parking<br><br>I will keep coming here monthly!

The last time I ate here was about a year or maybe two ago....  There were cockoraches in our booth, in the day time, which represents a large infestation.   It was completely disgusting.  The restaurant knew about the issue and tried to blame the connected commercial spaces.  Regardless, they had cockoraches and all the money they are making, they should only have the absolute best cleaning start and absolute best pest control service, but apparently they do not.   The manager moved us to the opposite side of the restaurant and didn&#39;t charge us for our dinner, because they were embarrassed.   As much as I love cheesecake factory and how they tried to make us forget about dining with cockroaches, in good conscience, I cannot go back to this location, knowing that their level of sanitation is inadequate or else they wouldn&#39;t have cockroaches.

I am always a fan of the Cheesecake Factory.. Yes, it is a major chain, but it is goood.. :)<br><br>I recommend the deep fried macaroni and cheese balls or the mac and cheese burger. It is delish and heavy, so come with an empty stomach and sched. a cardio the next day. hehe.<br><br>I like this Cheesecake Factory the best, but I believe it is all in all good.
I love the cheesecake factory. Took my Boyfriend here for the first time and he loved the spaghetti. They have something for everyone here.

Had the spicy cashew chicken for an early dinner. <br><br>I thought the coating/batter on the outside of the chicken was just a bit too soft. At the Cheesecake Factory in fashion valley (San Diego) it&#39;s more crispy and fresh. Still, the one in BH is passable. The Caesar salad was flavorful but the lettuce was too wilted for my taste. Could have been much better.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to this location on several occasions and I always make sure that I sit out front near the sidewalk. The people watching is outstanding. <br><br>Our server, Kurt/Curt, was new and you could tell. He was nervous. And he made sure that he told us that he was new. He handled our orders just fine but he struggled mightily with our neighbor (a 20-year veteran of the BH location). The woman asked for X and he brought Y. Customer pointed out that Y was not X. Tried again but this time the server brought A instead of X. The customer was clearly growing tired and impatient with the new server. The server eventually got it right, though. Anyhow, felt sorry for the guy. Hopefully he&#39;s given a chance to improve and excel.<br><br>All and all, very middle of the road experience. <br><br>I&#39;ll give them another chance in the near future.

Disappointing! Came here because everyone told me it&#39;s a must-go, but it was so disappointing to me. I had the mango key limes cheesecake, because I thought it might taste fresh and I don&#39;t like whipped cream. But they brought it with whipped cream all over the cake and even under the cream it was just a heavy, artificial and over sweetened wannabe cheesecake. My friend had the one with macadamia nuts and white chocolate. We both weren&#39;t able to finish it and we didn&#39;t even want to because it&#39;s not nice at all. It&#39;s also way too expensive for that kind of quality.

Where can I start? I order way more than I can eat in this place because I can&#39;t decide out of the huge menu. Avocado egg rolls, fried Mac and cheese balls, veggie burger with the side of fries, the Oreo cheesecake are my current favorites. I used to have the little crispy chicken sandwich before I stopped eating meat. I think it&#39;s the best dish on the menu.I take a bite from everything and take all the leftovers home:) The portions are huge. And everything tastes good. The service is great.

Lads, this place is exactly as you would expect. Good food, staff, premises. If you&#39;re looking for fine dining don&#39;t go, if you&#39;re looking for good food, beautiful coffee and amazing cheesecake you should go!!

Horrible service, host and management. We went there for lunch and the staff is super rude and unprofessional. We exited without placing an order. After filing our complain with the management they refused to handle it but instead emailed a gift card. I did not file a complain for free meal fix your shit or shut it down.
Good but every time I&#39;ve gone we get the same waiter and he always forgets somthing which is annoying

Really thought the order was coming from the Beverly Drive location...yes we were all feeling lazy was a late night waiting at the airport. Onion Rings, S&#39;mores cheesecake &amp; Buffalo Wings.<br><br>The onion rings were soggy and cold<br>Buffalo wings hard to explain they had this odd taste to them none of us enjoyed<br>We did polish off the cheesecake as it was remotely the only thing edible

I mean I don&#39;t know what to say except there was no wait and I have such a terrible waiter that it was hilarious. I had to laugh at the service. Also I might add they forgot to devein my shrimp for the second time. Do better - SMH (I ordered the lemon garlic shrimp off the skinny mini menu - which I must mention is amazing) <br><br>Side note the JW lemonade is delicious

I just had dinner here. I went to the bathroom midway through dinner and saw that the sink to wash my hands was full of vomit with beans in it. It was so full to the brim that it looked like a party of 6 had all contributed to this sink. I can&#39;t make this up. I feel cheated that I didn&#39;t find a used bandaid in my pasta. There is no cleaner in the facility. I overheard the managers asking the host to clean up the vomit, which is beyond his pay grade. I feel sick to my core that I ate are. This place is a travesty. I doubt it would pass a health inspection. In fact, I may call one in.

Don&#39;t let the beverly hills location fool you one bit! !!!!   This is basically a cheesecake factory with Hometown buffet service. NOT A SINGLE server, waiter, or cashier smiles.When paying for food at the To-go counter by the desserts, not a single cashier says, &#34;hello&#34; or &#34;how are you&#34; . Every employee looks  and acts as though they are working there against their will. Maybe its because their break-room lunch table is 5 feet from the toxic smelling dumpster out back . If you think im exaggerating the truth, then go to this location and see for yourself the downtrodden landscape that they call customer service. The food is okay, and decent enough if your hungry.  This review is based in 8 visits, and after spending enough money with this place and being treated like the non-appointment line at DMV, enough is enough. TRAIN YOUR EMPLOYEES TO PRETEND THAT THEY ENJOY LIFE!!!!

Jason was fantastic! He was so patient, so personal and just seems like a kind person.  Our food was great, as usual at Cheesecake; very consistent.  The valet parking was very nice.  <br>I just can&#39;t get over how awesome Jason was.... I hope there is only one Jason, but just in case we sat across from the bar next to where the servers pass through to the other side around 9-10pm!  (There was 3 of us).  He helped personalize out meals perfectly!  Great service always gets 5 stars!

I do pickup orders from here all the time for lunch.<br><br>The pickup employees are always extra nice. The orders are always ready in a timely matter. The orders are easy to place over the phone.<br><br>I really like the different kinds of items the menu offers, too. I got the salmon rolls today, and they were so delicious. I also like that you get bread with your meal. It&#39;s just a nice little gesture to add it to the order.<br><br>Definitely going to go here more often for lunch.

I really like this Cheesecake Factory. There&#39;s never a wait and the food is always good! Some of my favorites are: Tex Mex Eggrolls, BBQ chicken salad, chicken piccata, Chinese chicken salad. <br><br>Bonus: they allow dogs on the patio!

What&#39;s happened to The Cheesecake Factory? Food still delicious but have they cut their portions in half. We ordered food to go and I got chicken madeira one of my favorites. The portion was probably half the size of what it use to be. Also, got my son chicken strips kid portion---and either this was a mistake or they just stopped giving decent sized portions. <br><br>Once was a great place to go for great food and huge portions but the portion size is no longer what it use to be.

(Dined 3/18/12 SU): The name says it all, but it is so much more than that! I would start adding the word &#34;Burger&#34; to the name.<br><br>A friend and I had a free Sunday after we cancelled a wine tasting event due to possible inclimate weather (this never materialized), so we had an open day of psuedo-spontaneity which took us from the Valley, to the Eastside, Mid-Wilshire, and ultimately to the Westside at The Cheesecake Factory in Beverly Hills. Neither of us have been to this location, and I was driven by the $25.00 gift card that needed to be used.<br><br>Although my phone&#39;s GPS guided us here, we initially missed it because of a tall leafy tree covering up the store&#39;s neon sign out front. It was around 8pm when we finally walked in, and the place was packed...but not packed enough to seat us immediately. I can honestly say this was the first time I&#39;ve never had to wait to be seated. Karma was on our side this even, and in fact, the entire day.<br><br>At this point, we were both starving, so it took us some time to figure out what to eat because everything we saw around us and what we read on the menu was appealing to us. After getting glasses of water and at least decided on a blended mango margarita for me ($10.95), and a &#34;skinny-style&#34; red raspberry martini ($8.95) for my friend. I eventually decided on the Macaroni &amp; Cheese Burger ($11.95) and substituted for sweet potato fries ($1.00 extra), and the Fish Tacos ($13.95) for my friend. To finish off the meal, we had the Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake ($7.95).<br><br>While we carried on our insightful conversation and exhorted about our day&#39;s adventures, we enjoyed our drinks and the table bread and butter. I can&#39;t speak about her martini but I do love their margaritas, and this instance was no different. Our food soon came out and man did it smell amazing! Again, I can&#39;t speak about her fish tacos, but my glamburger was about to take over the world...like Kim Kardashian&#39;s ass! I literally had to size this bad boy up. Two encounters with humongous burgers in recent weeks, I don&#39;t think my heart can take it anymore! The best plan of action was to stack everything together and smash it all down, so at least it&#39;s manageable for me to wrap my pie-hole around it. I truly do love their assortment of glamburgers, and I&#39;ve never tried this one before. No words can do justice how much I thoroughly enjoyed the combination of throwing a dollop of fried mac &amp; cheese on top of my burger patty - ingenious! In order to have room for dessert, I had to have half of this and my always tasty sweet potato fries packed-up for a later meal. Now, I&#39;ve had the Reese&#39;s cheesecake which happens to be one of my favorites, and my friend loves peanut butter, so we were both on a peanut butter high. We amazingly polished off the cheesecake, probably to our detriment.   <br><br>One other thing (mentioned the waiting earlier) I&#39;ve always had an issue with them was their service. This time, I couldn&#39;t praise the service more. Our attractive waitress, Amanda, was very attentive and accommodating. Our water glasses were always filled (very important to me), and she was able to include some marinara sauce on my burger (I guess it normally doesn&#39;t) as it does when you only order the mac &amp; cheese. I should have asked for her number (I was with a more familial female friend so it would have been fine)! <br><br>Parking is everywhere, from the street, valet, and parking structures. We parked in the structure across the street with a flat $5.00 fee.<br><br>Overall, I&#39;m usually not a fan of chain restaurants (I do list Elephant Bar, Outback Steakhouse, Claim Jumpers, and Red Robin as some of my favorite chains), but if I keep having experiences like this with the Cheesecake Factory, I might have to add them to the list. Maybe I just have to come to this location! Their cheesecakes are undeniable, and I now always go for their glamburgers. These two menu items for me have singled them out among the crowd. There is value based on the portion sizes and as noted by the prices I quoted above (total bill was around $54.00 before gift card and tip). The atmosphere is casual and family-oriented, but this particular location had the lighting set to more romantic mood, which is fine by me. Because of the dim lighting, I honestly don&#39;t know how the décor is. Where we sat (close to the front window), it did feel a bit tight, but we made the most of it. And they take my credit card of choice...AMEX!

It&#39;s smaller than most, but food was great for me. <br><br>We went last week on a weekday, &amp; it was packed-presumably because it&#39;s summer. <br><br>I wanted to write a review to say that the Maitre D was amazing. <br><br>The restaurant was clearly very busy &amp; she kept a calm, coll, collected demeanor. <br>She was cordial with all patrons, even professional with kids. <br>Essentially, she was the calm amongst the chaos. <br><br>We had our baby with us, so our stroller was a bit in the way, in the very small entry hallway, &amp; she never made us feel intrusive or a pest, she would call out to the other patrons behind us, in a professional manner. <br><br>When we left, she also thanked us for coming-genuinely. <br>Very appreciated, since I know it&#39;s not necessary. <br><br>I didn&#39;t catch her name, but was was tall, slender, African American, with short hair &amp; shimmer/glitter on her arms-which I loved! So stylish! <br><br>I hope if she can&#39;t get a raise, she at least get&#39;s some credit &amp; gets to see/hear the review. <br><br>From someone who works hospitality-<br><br>You are amazing!<br><br>(only 4 stars instead of 5 because the place could clearly be staffed much better).

Contrary to some of the reviews on here, we received excellent service. Came in for lunch and ordered off their skinnylicious menu, which has a lot of great options - including a refreshing skinnylicious mojito and margarita! The burger was good, I like the bun - comes with side salad. <br><br>For tourists: this is the 1st/original cheesecake factory restaurant.
Really liked the avocado rolls. A little over priced for a chain restaurant but still good price for the area.

I am writing this review to acknowledge our server as she went above and beyond expectations.Yasmeen was either told by the customers sitting next to us or she may have overheard our conversation. At the end of our meal she showed up with a few other servers and surprised my parents with an ice cream sundae and said &#34;I heard it is your 59th wedding anniversary and you are an inspiration to all of us. We wanted you to have this.&#34; My parents and I were so touched by this act of kindness. I had not requested anything from the restaurant as we did celebrate their anniversary last week; however, today is my parent&#39;s actual anniversary, so this was so special and very much appreciated.

Came here for a date at 9:30 at night. Left at 11:45, and when we left there were still plenty of people here albeit dwindling down. Great atmosphere. Great food. But pricey. We got two mixed drinks (Tennessee Tea, Mojito and a dish of fries. 26 bucks.   Everything was delicious and fun, and warm (for sitting outside) but still, 26 bucks?<br><br>Whatever. Its one of the few places open past 10pm in Beverly Hills and we had a great time.
SMALL AF. Anxiety just standing in this claustrophobic waiting area. Small bar, tables like an inch from each other. Never again. I need air!

Love the jambalaya not to mention the carrot cake. Unfortunately what I saw disgusted me so much I will not be coming here. I saw the cooks spanking each other with the bread that&#39;s served to the customers, SMH.
Thank you, to the hostess - Aileen, who makes my visit to this restaurant location extra special. Always an attentive and polite service from her.

I used to love this place and could eat there every day, but lately it just isn&#39;t the same as it was.  I realize this is a very complex restaurant to manage.  The menu is so large and the service so demanding it&#39;s amazing they do what they do. But this location seems to be neglected by management.  <br><br>The service was so very slow I waked out after 40 minutes and went to a restaurant across the street.  I know the CEO of the company and know how much pride he takes in his restaurants, but just maybe the smallest and oldest one of his collection has fallen off his radar.  David, you might want to check it out every once in a while.  I know three stars to you is unacceptable, but there is a need for improvement.

The food was great but our waitress completely ignored us while constantly checking on the other tables in her section. I think we only saw her when she took our order then delivered the check. She literally never checked on us and I had an empty glass for 45 minutes. I just wanted a refill...the host was very nice and welcoming and food was good as usual. But awful service.

I have eaten at this   Factory numerous times but this time there was no wait so that is a star right there. Service was wonderful and very attentive, so there is another one. For a chain, I have to say the Beverly Hills location did a great job! I had the BLT burger. Generous beef patty smothered in blue cheese and bacon, mayo, lettuce and tomatoes erred with crispy double fried fries was perfect and just the right amount. I left feeling very satisfied. My husband had the Alfredo pasta and chicken. The sauce was surprisingly light with a lemony tang. Bread is always good. A very nice inexpensive lunch...bang for your buck in BH.

For a venue located in the heart of Beverly Hills, or better yet Los Angeles, I applaud it&#39;s use of space.  There&#39;s not much space in the surrounding area and this little restaurant chain is located in a busy street, but it still feels spacious inside.  Service is fast, food is what you expect of the cheesecake factory, and it&#39;s the only Cheesecake Factory I know around West LA so yeah... I&#39;m a fan. <br><br>5 stars would be parking that wasn&#39;t such a pain.

service and lighting at this location has always been meh. wait staff is transitory, bus boys are rude. however, the employees behind the to-go counter are really friendly. <br><br>I don&#39;t know why its always so dark in the restaurant, but this location needs a re-do in this dept. <br><br>other than that, food is as good as it was the last time you were here. what i love is that CF is comfort food for the flavors you grew up loving. Its really hard to not like what you order since its is a &#34;factory&#34;.

The Cheesecake Factory usually doesn&#39;t disappoint but this particular location wasn&#39;t the best experience. I want to give tremendous credit to our server, however, as he was patient and smiling through all my &#34;concerns&#34; ;). The food, as usual, was very good: Fried Mac n Cheese with the marinara sauce and a lovely salmon salad! What I&#39;m reviewing is the overall ambiance and vibe. It was very very cold and exceptionally dark where they sat us. And we moved from our first spot where the table was right in the middle if mainstream traffic. Service, though nice, was slow. For Beverly Hills, it seems they would be a bit more environment conscious and service oriented ;)

Went here with a friend for lunch after some retail therapy. She&#39;s not much of a foodie and suggested Cheesecake Factory.  Well, her shoes were killing her and it was the closest restaurant we could find!<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is pretty much as I remembered (in places like SF and Palo Alto) - huge portions, friendly staff and of course gigantic slices of cheesecake. <br><br>I ordered a salad and we shared a slice of cheesecake. Nothing stood out in terms of the food but the service was efficient.<br><br>I thought the restaurant had a convoluted layout. I went to the restroom and was suprised how far it was....you have to pass by the kitchen where servers were picking up orders and go up the stairs to the restroom. I had to be careful not to slip and fall because the floor was slick with grease from the kitchen. (!!!)<br><br>Next time I go shopping with my friend I&#39;m going to bring band-aids so she can hobble to a different restaurant!

Had a really great dinner here at the OG Cheesecake Factory. Great service. We were a large party and each person&#39;s food was done just right, from steak to pasta to salads! Really was a pleasant surprise. I remember when this place opened in the &#39;70s, and now they are everywhere.

‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍­Andrew is most professional, efficient, kind server and the quintessential representative  the Beverly Hills Cheesecake Factory store!  We only come to this  location because he is the server!  He knows all the family orders by  heart! He is bar none the most honest and humane person!  When Andrew takes care of our family the kids laugh more, smile more are happier and feel like they are being seen,  heard and taken care of authentically! The staff is very efficient and courteous, however, the standout is undoubtedly Andrew!  He makes our neighborhood a home  by including all our family in the new dishes and special, delicious appetizers!  We love  trying all the new add on&#39;s and he calls us all by name and remembers all the details!  Thank you  for hiring a real  angel!  We think  you are the smartest company out there!  We know so... because you only hire the best!  Please give this gentleman a raise!  Or we will have to start tipping him 200% to insure he stays with u and us!  We love  your company but most of all we adore Andrew M!

Just adding one more to their positive reviews . It&#39;s a great place for a good and cozy dinner . Tonight, I have been to this place with a friend for a dinner . They have a sweeping menu . Mostly, I  tend to order their pina colada for d drink so did I today . The food here is always saporous . Their chicken samosa and bang bang chicken have been on the top of my list to order in there . For the deserts part , all of them are good but I find their tiramasu and chocolate tower truffle cake extremely delightful . The service is decent .

I came in with a major sweet tooth looking fo a gluten-free cheesecake. Surprise! They had something for me. They claimed that their Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake was gluten-free. <br><br>I only ended up eating a few bites - it was very good, just a huge slice! - but all seems okay with my health. So I assume it&#39;s gluten free! :)

Came here around 10 PM on a week night because I was craving a piece of cheesecake.  I was in the mood for something classic/traditional but I was reluctant to order the plain cheesecake because I was not convinced that the quality would be up to my standard.  Instead I ordered the strawberry cheesecake.  The cheesecake was pretty good but nothing to brag about. The strawberries did not seem fresh at all. They had little flavor. The cheesecake crust was soft instead of having a slightly crunchy/hard graham cracker crust. The cheesecake could have been a lot colder. Not that impressed since I came here solely for cheesecake and cheesecake is included in the name of the restaurant.

The Cheesecake Factory is a great place for birthdays. I went there for my sons birthday. He loved the food along with the rest of my family. There spicy chicken pasta was outstanding. I loved the service they gave us too, they constantly checked up on us to see how we were doing. The desert is definitely what tops it all off. They have the best cheesecake in the world. Which is pretty self-explanatory due to its name. Overall this place is great and I will definitely go there again.

I&#39;ve been to a couple Cheesecake Factory locations and this, by far, has to be the worst!  From the moment we were seated in a back corner that felt like there was no running AC, to the 15 minutes we had to wait to have our drink order taken, we should have high tailed it out of there.  Our server was too busy chatting with the table next to us to even bother checking with us after our order was taken.  Our drinks were wrong but we could not flag him down to get things fixed. Our food was even worse and not once did he stop to ask if we needed anything or if our food was ok, which it was not.  I&#39;m so dissapointed because we&#39;ve never had such horrible service at other locations. Thanks for a horrible afternoon, Cheesecake Factory.

The service is awful!! This is my second visit to this location and the service hasn&#39;t improved!! WTF ?!  long time to get your order!! Almost half hour to get a cheesecake !!!! The only reason to give it a star is the service otherwise the quality of the food as usual ! I hope the person in charge would see this review to make any improvement !  I&#39;m fan of cheesecake and it&#39;s disappointed to experience this kind of service in Cheesecake Factory !! My suggestion is to find any nearby branch of Cheesecake Factory other than this one !

The biggest credit goes to our server ALINE. She needs to be promoted. Super friendly, professional and just goes above and beyond with her job. Thank you. And to be fair, the place, food and other staff are also wonderful.

This Beverly Hills location is the original and first Cheesecake Factory restaurant.  Service is great, it&#39;s a smaller space than the typical Cheesecake Factory, but it&#39;s clean and intimate.  Valet parking is available and the neighborhood has great shops that you can walk to after dinner or dessert.  The Chicken Bellagio is my favorite dish here...a must try!

Food was typical franchise. But the staff was GREAT!!! Especially the bartender!!! Soo busy and im amazed they dont add an extra bartender to assist back there. He was very kind and attentive. Red velvet cheese cake of course is the best ending  12pm

I guess I would rate it ok.  Most of the food coming out to tables looked good.  I was there for happy hour and ordered medium burger with fries.  The burger arrived well done not medium like I ordered and the fries arrived once I almost finished the burger.  So they need to work on timing and making sure that you get your meal the way you order it.  Might be worth going back one more time before making a final judgement. If they want a 20% tip in addition to salary then they better get the order right and delivered on time.

So my best friend and I are waiting for my take out right next to the kitchen and there&#39;s a burger and fries and a separate order of onion rings waiting for the waiter to come and take it to the table. It&#39;s 2:36pm on Tuesday April 21 and the manager keeps walking back and forth and picking up this customers onion rings and eating them. Two onion rings were attached to each other and she separated them and put one back on the plate, ate it, then licked her fingers and ate someone else&#39;s French fries. Omg I&#39;m disgusted this place eats half your food before you eat it! Come to find out she is a manager (Natasha - had to ask)... EW!!

Food was great and service too! I had the happy hour burger which came out delicious also the hostess took care of me along with the waiter. They ensured that I had a pleasant experience for my visit. Will be coming back if I&#39;m in the area.

I love cheesecake factory, but this location needs to be remodeled. Bathroom is smelly and the area around it. I think they keep the lighting low and dark so you don&#39;t see how shabby the place has become. I would really appreciated if they close for a month or two and remodel and clean up the place. :( <br>As many other cheesecake factories, there is long waiting time. I wish they would update their system and text you when ur table is ready. <br>Parking is bad, so we end up not going there bc of wait and parking.

This is the flagship Cheesecake Factory (first one) and they are alright enough. <br><br>Honestly, they are pretty meh. If you&#39;ve eaten at a Cheesecake Factory, you know the drill. Same menu - trillion things on it. You have to decide what you are going to eat out of their phone book and then, once it is delivered, prepare to eat all 14000 calories. Their servings are enough for a small family, so prepare yourself.<br><br>You will waddle out and try to remember why you went here again, since you&#39;ve been through this and knew it was just masochistic to go back. Visit at your own risk. <br><br>One little note, every dish seems like the cook dropped about 12 cloves of garlic in. You will taste your meal the rest of the day. <br><br>Oh, and get ready for this: They have a 7 layer chocolate cake which -- NOT JOKING -- has about 3700 calories PER SLICE.

I love this place for its happy hour prices (food), tasty menu choices, restaurant decor, and service. <br><br>I usually visit this Cheesecake Factory as a party for two and we share the following happy hour dishes: Avocado Egg Rolls, Chicken or Beef Sliders, and Calamari.  We also share a slice of cheese cake. The slices are huge, so it&#39;s definitely fit for two people, especially after feasting on the happy hour menu. <br><br>Every time I visit, I like to try a cheese cake that I haven&#39;t tried before. My favorite so far is the Ultimate Red Velvet cheese cake. Our bill usually totals to about $30-35, which is quite a deal for Beverly Hills. Never did I think I would be able to eat in such an upscale area, and a nice restaurant for this cheap! <br><br>Its a great place for a fancy date-night, without going broke :) Great food, service, location and price. No complaints here!
Fantastic food.<br>The Herb Crusted Salomon i recommend if you are looking for fish or some fresh meal.<br>For meat, the Hitachi Stake is very tasty! One of the best in La!

This was my childhood FAVORITE restaurant which I always found to be consistently good, but unfortunately my experience last night DESTROYED all of my preconceived happy notions of the place.  First off, our waiter, who designated himself as an esteemed &#34;trainer&#34; who travels to all the new Cheesecake factories to train staff took 10 minutes just to come over and take our drink order.  Then, after his pompous speech about how great he is, he reluctantly came back another 10 minutes later to take our order.  ANOTHER 30 minutes passed, and I complained about not having even gotten our appetizers.  <br><br>&#34;Shockingly&#34; our esteemed and self-identified expert Cheesecake factory waiter FORGOT TO PUT OUR ORDER IN!!!! 15 minutes pass, a very inexperienced manager came over to DEFEND himself rather than apologize, and sent us a completely wrong appetizer order! and again, instead of apologizing, the manager once again comes over to defend himself saying he didn&#39;t bother to look at our ticket order and just ran the food out.  As icing on the cake, the appetizer nachos were even dry, overcooked and COLD!<br><br>Because my friend had just gotten off a 13 hour shift and hadn&#39;t eaten, we took the manager on his word that our entrees would come out right away as we ordered.  A few minutes later (an hour into waiting for food so far) the food comes out, and again the completely wrong order and ICE COLD!!!<br><br>Once again, in the same manner as before, both the general manager and the waiter just stood by idly and had NO APOLOGIES WHATSOEVER for their horrible service.  <br><br>I am shocked and appalled by their disgusting behavior and lack of managerial and serving skills, particularly due to the fact that instead of apologizing they threw needless defenses at us, and I will definitely think THREE times before anyone mentions again there again.<br><br>Shame on them for ruining my night and happy thoughts of this place.

HORRIBLE and I mean HORRIBLE experience. First we waiting in line for togo orders that we called in for over 15 minutes. (okay fine they are busy I get that) WE get out food and everything was so rushed and the 4 people behind the counter were running around like chickens with their heads cut off. We get the food back to our office and I was absolutely mortified and what we saw. First and foremost all of the cheesecakes there thrown into small black boxes smashed in there and looked horrible. The pot stickers were cold and had some type of mystery meat in the box that clearly wasn&#39;t part of the order, the Avocado rolls was soggy and smashed. We ordered Chicken Sliders and they gave us beef! So we called the manager and spoke to Brian and he agreed and said that he knew the food sat and didn&#39;t look good for apologized.. WE said why didn&#39;t  you send it back and asked us to wait for proper food. He didn&#39;t have an answer. He just said he would give us the money back. at this point it doesn&#39;t matter about the money it matters the time we wasted on our lunch to go there and drive back to work! He said that he sent the pot stickers back and they were right away. and the meat was from something else he couldn&#39;t answer.. For this to be our go to lunch spot NOT anymore. Their Food, Service and presentation and gone down!! Lost loyal Customer&#39;s.

I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake factory locations throughout Los Angeles (Beverly Hills, Marina Del Rey, Encino, Pasadena) and even in D.C. a few years ago.  My favorite location is still the Beverly Hills location. <br>The service has always been excellent at Cheesecake factory, though the wait may be a little long if they&#39;re especially busy.  <br><br>The food is great -- I always take a long time deciding what to order because there are so many choices!  My favorite food here is their pastas.  I really like their Cajun Jambalaya pasta and their Fettucini with Chicken and Sun-Dried Tomatoes.  I&#39;m generally a big fan of sundried tomatoes, and the ones at Cheesecake Factory do not disappoint.  <br>I also really like their clam chowder soup.<br>Oh, and they have a great selection of cheesecakes (obviously) but my favorite is the classic strawberry cheesecake.<br><br>Note, however, that the portions are HUMONGOUS!  So be prepared to share or take half of your food home. <br><br>However, a word of caution to you health-conscious people: the food here is very high in calories.  A bowl of pasta here can run upwards of 2000 calories!  A piece of cheesecake could be 800 calories.  That is a lot... But everyone should splurge once in a while.  <br><br>This is a great place to go to for family meals, dates, a dinner with friends, birthday dinners, or large banquet dinners. They&#39;re nice about accommodating large parties.

Located in the heart of Beverly Hills, this spot is nearly busy all of the time. Good service, decent salad and delicious cheesecake. This time we tried a bit of the Lemon Merengue and Tuxedo. The Lemon was amazing and the Tux was good as well, more on the rich side.

This Cheesecake Factory is located in Beverly Hills.  The staff are professional and friendly. <br><br>The food keeps up the great standards of Cheesecake Factory.  From the drinks to the meals to the deserts, they are all excellent!<br><br>It&#39;s a great place for dates and families.  You can eat here then go to window shop at the high end boutiques.<br><br>Highly recommend it!

Beware, of a Jack Black look alike guy with a tie that works in the frontline. He might secretly pick at your food and discreetly eat it. I caught him twice! It was interesting to watch but also very gross. EEEUUUUUWWW!!!

Ordered for pick up over $200 worth of food.  Chicken wasn&#39;t cooked all the way.  And when we ordered two days later and mentioned it, they said we need to bring the food back to verify for credit.   We eat there three times a week for lunch and they dealt with us the wrong way.  They know who we are and they didn&#39;t take care of us.  I wonder if their food is all frozen and they microwave everything because it has a taste that just isn&#39;t fresh and some items are raw in the center.  BTW, what are their eggs made of, really?

I love The Cheesecake Factory!!! No matter what location I go to I am never disappointed!! (I hope I can always say that LOL) The lemon drop martini is ALWAYS on point, hands down!! My friend and I went in after 10pm and got some good seats at the bar. We just ordered appetizers since it was kind of late. We had the Buffalo Blasts (my mouth is watering as I type this) and the Crab dip I think. They both were delicious!!

Worst service of my life !!! The waiter treated us like shit and complained and rolled her eyes anytime I would ask s question or help ! They also did the same to the person sitting next to me !! They ignored us half the Time and gave us very bad attitude !! I am appalled and never coming again !

Hi marks for the service and an added mark for the waitress who thanked and wished us a good evening as we were leaving - she was not our waitress!<br><br>If you are a &#39;shroom fan (not the halucagen type) you must try the stuffed mushrooms from the small plate menu. These were the BEST stuffed mushrooms I&#39;ve ever had, and I think it is in part to not using seafood and drenching the suckers in a garlic and possibly parm sauce. YUMM YUMM!!!!<br><br>I enjoyed the bowtie pasta with chicken, mushrooms and peas. Very tasty and no skimp on the chicken.<br><br>And of course, dessert....you don&#39;t go to the Cheesecake Factory and leave without dessert!<br><br>My favorite is the Tiramisu Cheesecake, but since it is my favorite, I wanted to try another. Lemon Rasberry won the vote....and did so very well. This delight was drenched in a tart rasberry sauce and plated with CF&#39;s famous whipped cream. <br><br>Great service, tasty food, and sinful cheesecake....and for a chain, this was a nice location, too!
